text:
each of us has our own inner barometer for truth, and for some of us, we trust it completely. we have immediate signs within us that tells us if something feels truthful or doesn’t. but not everyone registers, or even deals with truth in the same way. and some people base truth on their personal biases, conditioning, and even prejudices. we are at a time where so much is being presented to us to decide if it’s truthful or not. the senate decision to vote judge brett kavanaugh to the supreme court after hearing both his, and dr. christine bradley ford’s testimonies, which under oath are meant to bring forward the best version of their truth,  really tests our ability to discern what is truthful, and what is not. even after an fbi investigation, whatever the outcome, we still must go by our own inner truth, which for me serves as a moral compass. we must dig deep in our hearts and souls and ask ourselves what feels most truthful, and what are the thoughts we hold in our minds; even if we choose not to share them. only we can decide what is truthful and what is not. “to thine own self be true”.....
.
.
.
.
.
#truth #truthful #knowwhatistrue #senate #supremecourt #brettkavanaugh #christineblaseyford #testimonies #someoneislying #youdecide #tothineownselfbetrue #innerbarometer #guidance #faith #dotherightthing #justice #law #judicialsystem #stopsexualabuse #believewomen #metoo #believesurvivors #menmustwakeup #menmustheal #healingofamerica #sayswho

text: time for a quick history lesson. “i’m not even sure we would get to a hearing. i think that a nominee would not make it. i think now we’re going to be vetting people to see if any of these issues are in their past. i think we’ve at least gotten that far.” -these are the words of #anitahill in a recent interview, 27 years after she testified in front of the senate judiciary committee that #clarencethomas sexually harassed her, and boy would she be wrong. anita hill was a black woman who was undermined, her story was not believed, and her credibility was stripped, on a national platform, by a committee of white men who exposed themselves as nothing short of biased and prejudiced. that same bias and prejudice is being exercised today against professor #christinablaseyford. both hill and ford expressed themselves calmly, intelligently, with poise. the same cannot be said for thomas and kavanaugh. recently, hill said, “[#kavanaugh] was able to express a real anger, an aggression, as well as a lot of emotion... no female supreme court candidate would ever have the license to express herself in that way. we still have so far to go in terms of the power that he [kavanaugh] had and the license that he had, to cry or be angry”. diversity has increased, but the senate still fails to be a representative body, which results in processes being upheld that are uninformed, and in no way reflect the reality of people’s lives in this country. anita hill started the conversation, and yes we have the #metoo movement, and yes the power dynamics and gender dynamics are shifting, but this hearing proved that there is still so much more work to do. || #blackhistory #americanhistory #history #blackwomen #women #feminism #racism #sexism #rape #sexualassault #sexualharassment #brettkavanaugh #christinaford #supremecourt
name: EBC

text:
standing up for the ones who can’t and the ones that won’t.

standing up to let abusers know their actions will not be tolerated & they will face consequences. 
standing up for my future children who will know they should never fear to speak.

standing up to prevent these abusers from abusing again.

standing up to let the 1 in 6 women and 1 in 10 male victims know they are not alone.

standing up in hopes that someone else will seek help or report their abuser.

standing up because i’m not a weak child who can’t speak for my own anymore.

these past 8 months working with the criminal justice system have been the hardest but most empowering months of my life. if anyone has gone through a similar situation or are currently going through this - feel free to reach out to me, no judgments here.  i’ve only spoke about this in front of close family & friends but i’m done being quiet. i was abused but i’m not defined by my abuse. it is nothing to be ashamed of. keep me in your thoughts/prayers as these 2 cases continue.

#metoo #warrior #speakup #notalone
#childsexualabuseawareness

text:
today my anger and frustration made it too difficult for me to meditate. 
i could barely form words in my journal to make my daily connection with the guides.
you see, i too am one of those who did not come forward at the time of my sexual assault and have found this week painfully triggering as i know so many of you have also. 
as much healing as i felt i have done around this episode in my life the wound remains. 
there is still much work to be done individually and collectively and today i commit myself to doing it. 
here is today’s wisdom from the akashic guides💥
“we see your anger.
we hear your anger,
and we can also see beyond this moment in time and witness that this feeling of destruction, of disillusionment is causing new movements,
ideas, and powers to be awakened within you.
you are hearing the calling of generations that have come before you.
lifetimes lived in earlier and even more repressive times.
this is healing on a massive scale that is being called forth within each one of you who is struggling to reconcile the injustices you see before you.
band together!
find strength and healing in uniting.
there is truth among you.
bring it out into the open.
speak it.
demand the change that is necessary, that your souls are calling you to bring forth.
use your anger to create the spark to burn down the systems that are meant to be destroyed.
you have everything you need.
the power is within you.
you will not be defeated!”
.
.
.
.
.
#wisdom#akashicmandala#channel#message#channeleart#mandala#design#meditation#tools#awake#artist#bethechange#metoo#ibelieveher#divinefeminine#rise#spiritual#teacher#guidance#riseup#onelove#power#love

text:
i have been hurting. yesterday marks a month since the most recent assault. i honestly can't even count which one this is, and that makes me livid. i am furious, and tired. 
supporting dr. blasey ford today brought together survivors at a time when i needed them most. to be surrounded by people chanting "we believe you" was a type of validation i didn't know i needed, and i'm so thankful to have experienced it this morning. i am unbelievably grateful to dr. ford for making me feel like i have a voice, and that i should feel empowered to use it.

believe survivors, but more than that--support survivors. ask how you can support. show that you care. i need that, and i know countless others do too. teach people about consent. communicate people before you touch them. and please call your senators to vote against kavanaugh.

#ibelieveher #believesurvivors #survivor #iamasurvivor #metoo #supremecourt #stopkavanaugh #supportsurvivors #strong #solidarity #callyoursenator #doyoubelieveme

text:
all those who've been impacted by sexual abuse face countless obstacles. for those who've been sexually assaulted in immigration detention, it often leads to more pain and trauma. as our co-founder/executive director christina fialho told the intercept earlier this year in regards to widespread sexual violence in immigrant prisons, "a person in immigration detention can’t just pick up and leave — they’re often forced to interact with the individuals who perpetrated the sexual abuse. and if they dare to speak up, they’re often retaliated against and then re-victimized by an ineffective or nonexistent investigative process.” we must #believesurvivors. we must end sexual abuse, in our homes, in our workplaces, in our schools, in our systems of mass incarceration. everywhere. to do that, we must #believesurvivors. 
#metoo #enddetention #freedomforimmigrants

text:
#whyididntreport i was 13 he was a friend of my moms. at first, i enjoyed the attention, then it quickly turned into something very wrong. had i asked for it? was it my fault? could i tell my mom? would she even believe me? she rarely believed anything i said at that age, so why would she believe this? did it really happen or did i make this up in my head? i was bleeding, i knew something happened, i knew it was very wrong, i was ashamed, i felt dirty, i was violated but somehow i convinced myself that it was my fault. i never talked about it, i ran away from home at 15 and was basically on my own from that point on. when i was 21, i told my mom, we were at a different stage in our relationship by that point and she believed me. it turns out, i wasn’t the only one. i have lived with guilt and shame all these years, could i have prevented this from happening to someone else? was i the reason another young girl suffered? we must not feel ashamed, we must speak out, we are not alone. 
#ibelieveyou 
#neveragain
#metoo
#noconfirmation 
#survivor

text:
i'm not freaking out over the news. i'm not losing myself to it. i'm a different #woman than i was in november of 2016 and january of 2017. i'm thinking that a lot of us are #different now. we're #stronger, we're #louder, we're more #calculated, more #effective, more #annoying (hopefully), better at #protectingourselves, and more #aware of the importance of #selfcare. lots of #more and lots of #better. we're not here for your entertainment (thanks, @pink), we're here to make our way and we're getting better at it. it's gonna be #yuge, just you watch. and we'll be there for the #wives, #daughters, #sisters, and #mothers in your life watching you lie and harm. you're so #uncomfortable right now because you know that your daughters now know how gross you are what lengths you'll go to try to disguise that. #weseeyou

tweet_full:
i am not freaking out over the news. i am not losing myself to it. i am a different #woman than i was in november of 2016 and january of 2017. i am thinking that a lot of us are #different now. we're #stronger, we're #louder, we're more #calculated, more #effective, more #annoying (hopefully), better at #protectingourselves, and more #aware of the importance of #selfcare. lots of #more and lots of #better. we're not here for your entertainment (thanks, @pink), we're here to make our way and we're getting better at it. it is gonna be #yuge, just you watch. and we'll be there for the #wives, #daughters, #sisters, and #mothers in your life watching you lie and harm. you are so #uncomfortable right now because you know that your daughters now know how gross you are what lengths you'll go to try to disguise that. #weseeyou

text:
until recently, i thought cspan was completely yawn-worthy and politics in general, were hit or miss.
yesterday, i have never lost so much faith in our judicial system. today, it's you, senate. extending my sincerest f××k you in particular to senator graham, kennedy, cruz and hatch. what an  embarrassment to not only your constituents but to your country. i hope everyone contacts their ridiculous senators.  because, not only is this supreme court candidate being accused of a crime-- the haste to push a candidate through without giving the public  an investigation is truly unamerican and i will not have it. that alone should piss the public off. 
wtf is going on with all of these conspiracies with trump and the clintons? no facts. i will not have that either. conspiracies have nothing to do with what is actually going on here. now. 
what is going on here is a dismissal of an individual's assault. a woman, no shock. yes, it was 30+ years ago, but that doesn't mean in didn't happen! survivors/victims (however you want to label) of assault carry that emotional weight for life. life!  it.does.not.go.away no matter how hard you try to shake it off. 
how the senate approached that situation in itself is telling. especially, since its public knowledge that 1 in 3 will be assaulted in their lifetime. check those sad statistics with the cdc. 
the mood to set the night on fire is real. for survivors of sexual assaults, for americans that believe in the fbi, for the base, or i guess baseless, grounds on our own democracy as we know it- get involved and lift each other up. 'til then, i'm going to breathe in a bag, because my teabag really, really set me off. f u teabag.

#senate #politics #fbi #investigate #stopthecircus  #loveyourneighbor #believewomen #american #metoo #micdrop

text:
jasmine was in my @doterra loyalty rewards package this month on a last minute whim and today i decided i’d look up what this oil represented in my “emotions and essential oils” book.
.
jasmine
~ the oil of sexual purity and balance :: jasmine nurtures healthy sexuality and helps to balance sexual forces. it asks individuals to honor and respect themselves and others. it encourages the release of past sexual trauma and facilitates the healing process. it supports the resolution of sexual trauma, encourages safety within intimate relationships and invites only the purest intentions to the sexual experience.
.
i have been triggered more than i expected to be the last couple days and this coincidence feels like a sign.
.
the past few days, weeks, years have reopened wounds. may every survivor heal in a way that serves them. advocacy. silence. meditation. therapy. a court case. telling one person or five. neither way is the right way or the wrong way. there is only your way to becoming whole 💕
.
tonight i will rub this on my wrists, meditate, journal, breathe and pray my perpetrator never gets to as high of a position as brett kavanaugh.

text:
nikki (@pnmera) shares her passion for singing and why she continues to do it.✨
•
•
“i recently turned 24 and it’s been a slow and scary journey to self love.
im still guilty of comparing my life the ones i see on social media but it’s something i try my best not to get consumed in. i work hard everyday to be the most authentic version of myself.  singing brings out the most vulnerable side to me because it scares the living crap out of me. im not singing for anyone but myself anymore. sharing my gift with the world is what i want most in life and i will not live in fear, i will live in love. i’m not scared to be accepted because i have accepted myself. this song rise up to me means breaking out of the mold and fighting to be someone i am proud of. i am worthy.” #ourwomensvoices

text:
i was sexually assaulted as an eleven year old girl by a family friend. he never saw justice. when i told someone at school my mom actually said "we thought she was over it". i was raped by a group of men as a teenager. when i finally confided in a teacher, she tricked me into making a police report. the police told me i didn't remember it right.

if  #metoo makes you uncomfortable or defensive, you are the problem. 
if you think rapists who aren't brought to justice aren't really rapists, you are the problem. 
if you think sexual assault is akin to being flirtatious fuck you - you are the problem.

text:
with all that’s going on, i just wanted to say that there are just so many #metoo experiences in my life i wouldn't know how to even begin to list them all. not to mention the 1000's of #metoo experiences others have shared with me in confidence (and not just women – many men too!)
.
i was about 27 in this photo, working through my death-and-rebirth healing and #integration via professional performing arts (and yes, #cannabis was very present). this image is an expression of the #minoansnakegoddess, a character in a series. during this time in my life #anitahill and her depth and courage saved my life. i was glued to the screen during the trials, having just survived 3 solid years of severe, sexually-motivated emotional abuse. i've never confronted my abuser publicly because i don't want to enrage him -- when you name an abuser, the abuser acts according to their character, and i have no interest in hearing one more word from him, unless it is in the form of a public apology. he knows who he is, as do the others. #ibelieveher
.
just to be clear, i also want to add that i'm a feminist who loves men/males. i am grateful for all the amazingly wonderful males in my life. my husband, my father, my two grandfathers, other family members, friends, colleagues, young men and boys who dubbed me "fairy godmother" -- and countless extraordinary mentors. the #metoo movement is not about hating men. if you hate (or blame, or mistrust, etc.) all males, then you are a sexist.
.
this is about #healing and #evolution, and healing and evolution takes #truth. love to all of you who dare to share your stories. love to all of you who chose not to. love to all those who have not had this type of experience personally and yet are willing and able to listen and learn. love to true patriots. love to everyone -- especially today. those of us who are victims -- and there are far, far too many -- may be feeling extra fragile today. please be extra loving and kind.
.
#love, zoe
.
#psychedelicfeminism
.
.
.
#cosmicsister #zoehelene #ecofeminism #maps #women #earth #nature #wellness #sacredplants #entheogens #ayahuasca #cannabis #womensupportingwomen

text:
@voxdotcom 🇺🇸
it feels like 1991 all over again.

that year, clarence thomas was nominated to the supreme court, and anita hill testified that he had sexually harassed her. the senate judiciary committee failed to call additional witnesses whose testimony could have supported hill’s account. thomas has now served on the supreme court for nearly 30 years. 
the outcome of the allegations against kavanaugh will be a profound test of the power of #metoo. before the movement began, a supreme court nominee could be publicly accused of sexual misconduct and be confirmed anyway. so far, kavanaugh’s confirmation process has unfolded in much the same way thomas’s did. we’re about to find out if the result will be the same. #kavanaugh #christineblaseyford #anitahill

text_retweet:
#repost @mattmcgorry with @get_repost
・・・
brett kavanaugh is the symptom. rape culture and patriarchy is the disease. same with trump. same with the rapists outted by the #metoo movement (not to mention white supremacy, capitalism, etc). men, if you actually care...listen to women, and the women on the front lines of the anti-sexist, anti-rape culture, feminist movement and get to work. and if you’re a man, wondering if i’m talking about you, i can assure you that i am. you need to be a man that other men know stands against rape culture. that other men know won’t let this shit slide. that other men can come to you with their questions about what to do to be a part of the solution. we all have circles of influence, and we need to influence them. we don’t deserve credit for not being a kavanaugh, a trump, or a weinstein. the only way to change this world to make it safer for women and girls is to be preemptive and do the shit that you see almost no other men doing. when you see lots of women in your life re-posting an article or a meme about rape culture, but not men doing it, you do it. violence against women is *men’s* violence against women over 99% of the time. this is our job to fix. guys, next time you hear liberal men complaining about kavanaugh, ask “what are you doing to end rape culture?”

text: i know what it's like to report a man only to have authorities tell me "he didn't break any laws." i know what it's like to seek advice from advocates who tell me they'll support me, but that it's unlikely a judge will grant me a restraining order. i know what it's like to support friends who have been harassed or assaulted. i've written countless stories about strong women whose attackers have never known a day of punishment. nor, likely, have they ever feared a day of punishment. why would they? we as humans have so many metaphorical mountains to climb, but i'm confident in our ability to do it. i'm frustrated, but i'm also hopeful. thanks to everyone showing, speaking and writing about your experience. that takes unbelievable courage. i believe and stand by you. #believewomen #metoo

text:
*trigger warning for assault victims*
#whyididntreport
i’ve always considered myself strong. what ballet and the school of hard knocks didn’t teach me, former middleweight champ michael olajide jr. did.
.
i never understood how sexual assault victims could leave a crime unreported.
.
until it happened to me.
.
even then, it took me over a year of deep psychological denial before i was able to admit i’d been raped. i’m a trained fighter who was mentored by the best to compete & teach boxing and have never been someone who allows others to treat me like a doormat. but the shame i felt was so overwhelming i couldn’t admit it, even to myself.
.
that’s the thing about sexual assault- it fucks your mind up. it made me feel worthless, powerless, nowhere near the warrior i’d considered myself to be. my very identity was challenged.
.
i didn’t report my rape because by the time i was able to actually articulate what had happened i had no way of identifying my rapist- a stranger, from another country, long gone by then.
.
i’ve fought this demon ever since.
every lover i’ve had has had to deal with the fallout from what he did.
.
and the sad thing is, i’m almost relieved i didn’t report it, so i didn’t have to deal with incredulity, victim blaming or a system that’s supposed to help but actually creates more trauma.
.
unless it’s happened to you, you can’t know. you just have to listen to us. we’re the majority of women out there and we’re in pain.
.
we need you to hear us for true healing to occur.
i stand in solidarity with my sisters, brothers and other siblings who’ve also been through this. the new strength i’ve found since, i’ve drawn from knowing you and discovering i’m not alone.
.
📷: no makeup, no photoshop, just me + @bb_pictures
.
@metoomvmt 
#metoo #metoomovement #notokavanaugh #survivorsspeak

text: thank you, dr. christine blasey ford. i am a survivor too. i wrote you a long letter this morning. maybe i will share it on a different day. the prevalence of sexual violence is such a tragic human rights issue. i am so sorry that this happened to you. it’s just infuriating that this awful crime and violence continues to be perpetuated by culture, institutions, entitlement, patriarchy and those that do not believe survivors. i am really proud of you for sharing your experience with the world despite how survivors are treated. how terrifying that must have been for you. if you would have made the choice to not share your experience publicly, or at all, or because you couldn’t, i would still be proud of you. i hope you can feel proud of yourself too. my heart also goes out to those who have experienced similar traumas. you are seen and heard and valid. i believe you. i support you. i care. you are brave and beautiful. we all deserve better.

text:
an undeniable shift in mass consciousness is happening. shifting from a linear place of patriarchal egoism to an expansive place of divine feminine love. from weinstein to cosby to kavanaugh; more and more women are standing up against their accusers. we are taking a stand together and will no longer be silenced. this isn’t about just “girl power,” this is the power of sheros standing together united as one. rise up soul sisters, rise up!

text:
years ago, i thought i couldn’t accomplish anything great. there was a desire in my heart but my insecurities prevented me from taking action. i actually literally used to walk with my head down and wouldn’t even let people hug me. how could a girl like me be worthy of a hug? all they would do was hurt me, right?
..
i think in today’s society we get caught up on this invisible struggle: comparison. we think that we can’t accomplish something because we don’t measure up! double tap this if you have been there!
..
i think that we have to learn to embrace the beauty and strength within ourselves so when we look into the mirror we say danggggg girl, you got it going on! 🤷🏾‍♀️😂
..
there are so many other speakers and designers out there. i actually failed my public speaking class and i did not go to design school. instead i got that holy spirit do your thing attitude. i walked into my calling because i was confident i was going somewhere in life that was perfect for me!
.
.
if you are one of those women who feel like you have nothing to offer because of your past, let me tell you...you absolutely have something to offer in this world. on the other side of fear are results. you have to take a step forward in anticipation for the future cause darling, you are going places! 💃🏾
..
tag a friend you want to hear this! leave your comments below about your journey!👇🏾

text:
trigger warning ⚠️ the first memory i have of being molested was when i was five. my paternal grandfather was buckling me into my booster seat and somehow 🤷🏽‍♀️ his hands ended up underneath my underwear. when i was nine i was doing my homework and he picked me up and placed me on his lap and decided to kiss my neck and run his hands all around my body. when i was eighteen he picked the lock of the room i was staying in and attempted to watch me shower. when i was 27 i pressed charges. when i was 28 i sat on the stand with my paternal family and my sisters and mom in the audience. while i recounted every single time he was on top of me, inside of me, around me, and destroying me. half of the audience laughed and shook their heads accounting my memories to false allegations. the other half of the room sobbed as they heard the real childhood i experienced. when i was 29 i watched him be taken away in handcuffs for a 3 year sentence. at 31 i discovered he was being release on good behavior. at 33 i relive it while watching another woman have to revictimize themselves to the world because we need someone to hear us and see us and believe us. i’m telling you ladies, you are heard. you are loved. and you are believed.  call your senator and tell them to stop the vote. to allow the fbi to investigate. do this for the women in your life who are sobbing on their couches watching this hearing because they too know what it’s like to be a survivor. 
if you have a k on your follower count and aren’t advocating for women, are you even an influencer?  the only thing you’re trying to influence is your wallet. ✌🏽

text:
(tw: sexual assault)
i’m angry. 
no, i’m more than angry. 
i don’t think anger is enough to describe the level of frustration i feel right now. i’m pissed off because believing women should be enough.
i don’t care about your education. your ability to raise a daughter. how many women you’ve respected since then. we aren’t talking about that, we are talking about your past actions, actions that have consequences whether it was reported directly or 36 years later it doesn’t matter. 
i’m so frustrated because i know what it’s like to suffer in silence, because it’s happened to #metoo 
i know what it’s like to be afraid of disturbing the peace. afraid of coming forward with something that is so extremely personal and traumatizing.
i know because i experienced my own trauma and it was so traumatic i didn’t even remember it happened until years later. and then after 10 years i finally chose to confide in a family member only to get the response “it was probably just his hormones.” i’m sorry but that is fucking bullshit. 
this is why women don’t speak up because we are invalidated, denounced, 
and told that we are liars or seeking revenge. 
i was 9 years old, there is no fucking excuse for that, what revenge was i seeking. to say that what happened to me was just because of a boys hormones, that boys will be boys, perpetuates the rape culture that our society is so quick to contribute to. maybe without even realizing.
i grew up with this secret and still to this day have told very few people mostly because it would ruin my family. 
i’m ruined already but what does that matter, right? because i’d rather hide than face the scrutiny from them. 
i’m afraid because i don’t know if they’d believe me. 
maybe they’d be angry and i don’t want them to be angry with me. 
let’s stop right there. 
i’m afraid to come forward because i think someone is going to be mad at me because i was molested and violated. 
that’s bullshit. 
my voice should be heard, but i really don’t know if i’ll ever say anything besides this.
i grew up with my family commending him for his achievements in school, in boy scouts, at church and in his career. (continued in comments)

text: i know i made this account to support taylor, and i know many of my followers do not live in america, but we need to talk. to my younger followers: pay close attention now, learn to use your voice for good. to my older followers: use your privilege to vote. today it was decided that the decision for kavanaugh to be a part of the supreme court justices will be moved to the floor (11-10). it was also decided that the fbi will investigate for 1 week before any other decisions are made. yesterday, dr. ford told the world of how she was sexually assisted by kavanaugh. i believe her, and you should too. america is becoming so divided but we need to remember that respecting human life is not a political view. we need our voices to be heard. as swifties, we supported taylor during her time of hardship. we must do the same not only for dr. ford, but for all the people of this country. use your voice.

text:
from @wisetobewild -  today with a quivering voice, i heard dr. christine blasey ford admit she was terrified and proceed with her testimony anyway. although i have always been in support of the me-too movement, i never really shared my own story. but something about her courage makes me want to finally say #metoo. ⠀
⠀
its happened more than once. in momentary awkward ways that made me feel embarrassed and small. it's happened in catastrophic ways that left me sobbing with a sense of shame that sat in my stomach for years. my abusers were strangers, acquaintances, co-workers, people i thought were my friends and even people i thought loved me.⠀
⠀
why i didn't report.....because not only was i in denial but the entire world around me was as well. just like my culture blamed me, i also blamed myself. ⠀
⠀
but i do not say this as a victim but as a survivor. each time i got back up, healed the wound, and learned how to love and trust again.⠀
⠀
to all the survivors- you're not alone. although the world might try to deny, accuse, attack, berate and belittle- i hear your story, i believe your truth and i stand with you. courage is contagious. thank you to all of the hundreds of thousands who gave me the courage i have today. ⠀
⠀
⠀
⠀
⠀
⠀
⠀
⠀
#believesurvivors #metoomovement #metoomovement2018 #whyididntreport #ibelieveher #believewomen #survivor #ptsd #ptsdawareness #womenempowerment #womensupportingwomen #feminist #trauma #healing #therapy #mentalhealth #mentalhealthawareness #christineblaseyford ⠀
⠀
⠀ - #regrann

text:
gonna talk about something that is kind of a bummer, so here's a picture of lilly's sweet face getting a chin scritch.
___
cw: abuse/assault/trauma
___
every single member of my care team agrees -- my body is worn out from c-ptsd and repeated head/spine trauma as a teen. i've been fight-and-flighting constantly for over 10 years. that does real, physical, permanent damage. it's possible some of my illnesses i would have developed to a lesser degree even without trauma, but there is no denying the role it has had in the seriousness of where i am now, at age 25.
___
there are a million reasons this is especially relevant this week. believing survivors, taking abuse seriously, and addressing signs of trauma early is absolutely vital. abuse and assault can physically destroy people physically and mentally for decades afterward, and there is research that shows trauma markers being passed down generationally... that means children made physically vulnerable by the abuse their parents survived. one hurt person should be enough for us to care, but it is never just one person. never. 
___
care. learn the signs. ask questions. interfere. save the next person from the physical consequences i'll live with the rest of my life.
___
#believesurvivors #metoo #ibelievechristineblaseyford

text:
i have no memory of being molested by my uncle's friend when i was 5.
.
i remember everything about the day i was raped in 2004, except his name. i'm not sure i would necessarily recognize him in a crowd, either.
.
no one pressed charges when i was 5. my parents didn't want me to go through the pain of a trial.
.
the guy who raped me in 2004 was arrested, but the authorities talked me out of going any further with pressing charges because of the "circumstances" and that my entire life would be dragged through the mud. .
these are but a plethora of reasons why many girls and women never report acts of sexual violence done against them. we are told to "keep quiet" and go on with our lives as though nothing ever happened.
.
but something did happen. and it's not something that ever truly goes away.
.
while i am able to live a "normal" life today, the residual effects of what happened to me will always be there. one major side effect to what happened...i am severely claustrophobic.
.
my hope in sharing this is not for pity...ever! i refuse to be a victim...i am a survivor!
.
rather, my hope is that this encourages more boys, men, women, and girls to understand that this "rape culture" society that we live in can no longer be tolerated.
.
there is always a better way.

text:
i believe her. ✨
as a woman... i have stories & have heard stories from friends, family, and clients. and i believe everyone who has shared. regardless of whether they are female, but because they are human beings. ✨
because people do not recount their trauma lightly. many do not share because of the pain, shame, guilt, worthlessness they feel. so when anyone shares a trauma... the best thing we can do is listen and hold space for them. hold their grief until they are ready to let go. ✨
to the people reliving their own traumas because of the trial: you are worthy, just as you are.
✨
to the people with trauma and pelvic pain... we (pelvic health providers) are here for you.
✨
to people struggling to understand what’s happening: keep trying to see a different perspective. it will unite us.

#ibelieveher #sexualtrauma #metoo #ibelievechristineblaseyford #pelvicpt #pelvicfloorpt #pelvichealth #dpt #wcs #pelvicpain #traumacanbehealed

text_retweet:
#repost @bobby_cannavale
・i still believe her. look, lots of emotional responses to my post yesterday. lots of vitriol. it’s ok, free country and all that. speaking for myself and only myself? i believe in trying to change our culture of treating women like they’re second class humans, like their testimonies are unimportant and a distraction. equality for women, for people of color, for our lgbtq brothers and sisters is something we need to, collectively, continue to strive for. otherwise, who are we? i know it’s popular to say hateful shit to each other right now, especially while hiding behind private accounts, again all good, free country. i’m gonna keep trying to listen and to understand what these incredibly brave women have to say.i believe dr. ford. i will continue to listen and to believe these women in my gut. and if you don’t like what i have to say, again, all good. just unfollow. #metoo
#judgekavanot
#drivethemallout

text:
proud to say my representative nydia velasquez, the first puerto rican woman to be elected to congress, was among the congressional women who protested the kavanaugh vote.
 at least at home in ridgewood, queens i know someone has my back. 
protesters included reps. pramila jayapal (d-wash.), judy chu (d-calif.), val demings (d-fla.), grace napolitano (d-calif.), nydia velazquez (d-n.y.), grace meng (d-n.y), jan schakowsky (d-fla.), barbara lee (d-calif.) and others.

#stopkavanaugh #metoo #believewomen #ibelievechristineblaseyford #ibelieveher #imwithher #imwithchristine #ridgewoodqueens

text:
i decided to open up about a difficult experience in college for the first time with those of you who i don’t know and who i have never met with the hope that it will bring some healing to the past hurts or those you may be walking through currently. *
*
*
to be honest, i had a lot of anxiety about returning to my undergraduate campus because of some of the emotion i knew this visit would inspire now that i no longer self medicate with alcohol. once i arrived i saw just how much the relationships i’ve cultivated since graduating have helped and i want you to experience the same. click the link in the bio to watch the video so that we can talk. i’m transparent so that i can give god the glory with how far i’ve come and i hope you can recognize how sensitive this discussion is. *
*

text:
my heart is heavy today pondering the weight of history, the responsibility of men - yes, men, to repair what we carelessly broke and our too-slow journey to create a happy, equitable world for all. for some reason i think of a man who would never have survived the #metoo  movement, but who would have skewered and roasted today's pale-faced, tie-wearing swine feeding at the troughs of power and injustice.

edward abbey. “one final paragraph of advice: do not burn yourselves out. be as i am – a reluctant enthusiast…a part-time crusader, a half-hearted fanatic. save the other half of yourselves and your lives for pleasure and adventure. it is not enough to fight for the land; it is even more important to enjoy it. while you can. while it’s still here. so get out there and hunt and fish and mess around with your friends, ramble out yonder and explore the forests, climb the mountains, bag the peaks, run the rivers, breathe deep of that yet sweet and lucid air, sit quietly for a while and contemplate the precious stillness, the lovely, mysterious, and awesome space. enjoy yourselves, keep your brain in your head and your head firmly attached to the body, the body active and alive, and i promise you this much; i promise you this one sweet victory over our enemies, over those desk-bound men and women with their hearts in a safe deposit box, and their eyes hypnotized by desk calculators. i promise you this; you will outlive the bastards."
name: michael keys

edward abbey. “one final paragraph of advice: do not burn yourselves out. be as i am – a reluctant enthusiast…a pa-time crusader, a half-heaed fanatic. save the other half of yourselves and your lives for pleasure and adventure. it is not enough to fight for the land; it is even more impoant to enjoy it. while you can. while it’s still here. so get out there and hunt and fish and mess around with your friends, ramble out yonder and explore the forests, climb the mountains, bag the peaks, run the rivers, breathe deep of that yet sweet and lucid air, sit quietly for a while and contemplate the precious stillness, the lovely, mysterious, and awesome space. enjoy yourselves, keep your brain in your head and your head firmly attached to the body, the body active and alive, and i promise you this much; i promise you this one sweet victory over our enemies, over those desk-bound men and women with their heas in a safe deposit box, and their eyes hypnotized by desk calculators. i promise you this; you will outlive the bastards."

text:
remember that no matter what is going on in this crazy (sometimes horrific) world of ours that you are strong, capable, and you are love. you are love. speak your truth like spitting flames until it no longer burns you. 🔥until the flame no longer rules you. then use your fire to be a light that this world so desperately needs. ☀️remember that even if some white men don't believe you, the rest of us do. remember that if the first, second, or even third person won't listen to your truth, we will. your truth is power. your truth can heal. your truth is what this world needs. ❤️
📸 @sjanaelise

.
.

.

text:
"men are afraid that women will laugh at them. women are afraid that men will kill them."
- margaret atwood

i write a poem today (link in bio). my heart is both filled and heavy today. filled because i see women and men rising and supporting each other, being respectful and listening. heavy because we have so far to go. if you think we live in a society that supports equal rights, ask yourself why a woman is still afraid to walk down the street by herself, even in the most affluent of neighbourhoods.

some coworkers and i were talking the other day and one of the females said "what's the first thing you do when you get in your car?" to which i immediately responded "lock your doors." our male colleague looked at us quizzically. 
as women we have been programmed our entire lives to be on the lookout, to act as if we are always being hunted, to protect ourselves. 
when i  used to walk home from my friends house, at ten years old, i carried a whistle. 
and as i grew older and was approached not once but twice, i understood why the whistle was important. 
now is not the time to be still or silent and like the whistle, i have a voice so i am going to use it. 
i have also seen acts of courage and support and protection from important men in my life and for that i am grateful and blessed. day 73 of #100daysofgratitude ... i don't begrudge my life's lessons. i am grateful they have made me the strong, outspoken and courageous person i am. i am also grateful for the amazing people i have had the privilege to have met, who have stood with me, spoken up for me and protected me. •

#grateful #gratitude #metoo #whyididntreport #ibelieveher #blog #ygkblogger #risingwoman #westandtogether #thankyoudrford #believewomen #believechristine

now is not the time to be still or silent and like the whistle, i have a voice so i am going to use it. 
i have also seen acts of courage and suppo and protection from impoant men in my life and for that i am grateful and blessed. day 73 of  ... i do not begrudge my life's lessons. i am grateful they have made me the strong, outspoken and courageous person i am. i am also grateful for the amazing people i have had the privilege to have met, who have stood with me, spoken up for me and protected me. •

text:
tw: rape/ sexual assault
it’s infuriating and heartbreaking that all survivors, but especially women, have to repeatedly out themselves and relive their trauma in order to legitimize the abuse they suffered. dr. ford is courageous, resilient, and strong in ways i can't even comprehend. i believe dr. ford and i believe survivors. full stop. even if they chose not to report.
-
✖️i chose not to report because the person who assaulted me was friends with most of the people in my high school friend group.
✖️because i received anonymous threats from the person's friends on social media and was terrified of more social backlash.
✖️because it wasn't rape and i wasn't sure if what happened to me "counted".
✖️because i eventually stopped saying no and thought that meant it was my fault.
-
💌 to every other survivor out there who's been silenced, marginalized, or harassed. for every survivor who has doubted the legitimacy of their trauma. for survivors of color who could not report because of a racist criminal justice system. for indigenous women whose stories and livelihood are often ignored and forgotten. for male survivors who were told men can’t be victims of sexual violence. for lgbt survivors who are told that assault can’t happen in a queer relationship or who didn’t report because they would have to out themselves.
-
✖️what happened isn't your fault.
✖️even if you didn't fight back.
✖️even if you didn't directly say no.
✖️even if you did say no and then stopped.
✖️even if it happened in the context of a committed relationship.
✖️even if you didn't tell anyone.
✖️even if it doesn't fit the typical assault narrative.
-
➡️ it wasn't your fault.
➡️ you didn’t deserve it.
➡️ and you never have to face this alone.
➡️ i believe you. there is a whole community of survivors and advocates who believe you.
➡️ and no matter how many people question it, and whether or not you speak up, your trauma is real and valid.
-
💌 you shouldnt ever have to out yourself as a survivor, but if naming your pain, speaking that truth, and sharing feels important and is something that will help you heal - you're allowed that. always.
#daniellkoepke

text:
in watching this sadness play out on the national scene...i just keep thinking why would this woman put herself and her family in danger to lie and defame this man if he didn’t do it? just because? to protect her political interests? no sane person would hijack their life and their kids’ lives to make a political point. i believe she’s telling the truth. but gosh dang. how many women have to come forward to be believed over one man? cosby...kavanaugh...trump. it’s all the same. i will always believe women because it’s happened to almost every woman i know in some form or another. and there is nothing to gain by lying. if anything our society has taught women to shut up or be shamed. i know the “boys will be boys” thinking too well. how many of you thought about whether men were thinking “shit....that’s assault? it wasn’t that bad what he did.” it pains me to admit that i questioned this, but i did.
.
and always back to my original question in these tough politically charged posts...what are we teaching our children? when my daughters get to an age where they understand, i’d like them to know that no one will ever get away with harming them, that it’s not their fault, and i will always believe them. and on the flip side, i want all the young men out there to know that this behavior is never ever tolerated. it can ruin someone else’s life, as well as your own.
.
thank you @narvaez_art for the poignant illustration that prompted me to speak up. 💛
.
.
.
.
#scotus #stopkavanaugh #christineblaseyford #anitahill #timesup #metoo #notokay

text: on the outside i may look like this, but on the inside, my emotions are a total wreck. (t/w for sensitive eyes!)today was quite possibly the most traumatic day of my life, which began by me nervously throwing up the few sips of coffee i had had. then i wept and felt my entire body tremble with anxiety. then, i “stepped up to plate” and let the judge know that his “strike” should be the last of its kind. and the judge declared to him, “you’re out!” #metoo #triggersarenotjokes #believesurvivors

text:
where do i start?
______
this week two things happened: #nationaldaughtersday and the unbelievably moving testimony of dr. ford. coincidence? i don’t think so.
______
my role as a parent weighs heavily on me. i know every parent feels burdened by this assignment, but i feel especially burdened by raising my 3 girls in today’s cultural climate. if i think about one of my daughters joining the #metoo or #whyididntreport movement, i completely lose it. god have mercy on me as their mom and have mercy on them. protect their sweet spirits, i pray.
______
someone i care deeply about told me a story recently; she’s an educator. she told me that a group of male students addressed her as ‘ms. butt cheeks” when she walked passed them. these boys are in the seventh grade! i want to be shocked that our little boys think it’s appropriate to talk to a female teacher this way. but i can’t be. and her story is not her own. it’s the same story suffered by women everywhere.
______
enough!
______
we have had enough.
______
to my london, my ruby, my remi: i pray you come to saving faith at a young age. i pray you trust in a god who created you just as you are for his glory and no other reason. all you are - all you become - are his. you. are. his. he values you because he made you. it has nothing to do with how pretty you are or how smart you are or how athletic you are or what you can do for him. no! he loves you, he values you, he sees you, he cares for you, because he made you. so reflect him, my little lovies, in all you do. reflect the light.☀️
name: Lindsay Benedetto
tweet_full:
where do i start?
______
this week two things happened: #nationaldaughtersday and the unbelievably moving testimony of dr. ford. coincidence? i don’t think so.
______
my role as a parent weighs heavily on me. i know every parent feels burdened by this assignment, but i feel especially burdened by raising my 3 girls in today’s cultural climate. if i think about one of my daughters joining the #metoo or #whyididntreport movement, i completely lose it. god have mercy on me as their mom and have mercy on them. protect their sweet spirits, i pray.
______
someone i care deeply about told me a story recently; she’s an educator. she told me that a group of male students addressed her as ‘ms. butt cheeks” when she walked passed them. these boys are in the seventh grade! i want to be shocked that our little boys think it’s appropriate to talk to a female teacher this way. but i can’t be. and her story is not her own. it’s the same story suffered by women everywhere.
______
enough!
______
we have had enough.
______
to my london, my ruby, my remi: i pray you come to saving faith at a young age. i pray you trust in a god who created you just as you are for his glory and no other reason. all you are - all you become - are his. you. are. his. he values you because he made you. it has nothing to do with how pretty you are or how smart you are or how athletic you are or what you can do for him. no! he loves you, he values you, he sees you, he cares for you, because he made you. so reflect him, my little lovies, in all you do. reflect the light.☀️

text: the trees are dancing and the sea is moving, but i feel stuck. the injustice of silencing women’s voices is sickening and draining. why are women liars and conspirators “out to ruin the careers, lives, and reputation of men” when they speak up about their sexual assault? why is it so difficult to hold men accountable for the abuse and trauma inflicted on women? one night, while in college, i went to a party at a trusted friends home and drank heavily. the next morning, i woke up naked in a strange house, a strange bed, with a strange man that i vaguely remember speaking to the night before. terrified, i woke him up and told him to take me back to my friends house where we were the night before and where my car was. we sat in silence for miles as he drove me back. miles he took me from where we were - obviously he was coherent enough to drive while i sat blacked out in his passenger seat the night before. i never told any of my friends. i was too ashamed. i was afraid i would hear, “well you were wasted so you probably said yes”. i would never have said yes to this man. never. it’s been almost a decade. i’ve never detailed this story to anyone, but i’ve thought about it countless times, disgusted with this man and myself. i wish i would have said something. i wish i could say something now, but i have no idea who he is. probably some nobody who can hide his assaults on drunk women at college parties. my hands tremble as i type this memory. my friends, family, and strangers who follow me will see this and wonder why i remained silent, while others will slut-shame me and blame me for putting myself in that situation. and then there will be those who say, “if i were you, i would have...” it’s a lose-lose for us. we will always be the sirens that are blamed for the actions of men and no matter what action we take, no justice is to be served. #ibelieveher #metoo #fuckthepatriarchy
name: Shelly Rows

text:
tl;dr - be excellent to each other.

this week has been utterly gut wrenching for so many of us as we navigated the trash fire news and struggled to find balance between the need to safeguard our own mental health with the desire to show support for survivors of sexual harassment and assault. my own anxiety, frustration and rage peaked after one too many triggers as i melted into a despair that left me screaming at my poor husband at 2am like some rabid toddler from hell. lashing out at those you love is never ok, and i was deeply embarrassed by my behavior. the next day this man came home with a bouquet of roses (orange for halloween & women’s rights!) coffee, and a bag of my favorite comfort foods. when i told him i had been awful and didn’t deserve his sweetness, he hugged me and said “you always deserve it. i know you’re stressed. i love you.” it was such an act of kindness and empathy at a time where by all counts, he was the wronged party. just wanted to hold this wonderful human up and share how proud i am to be loved by him and how deeply i appreciate his support and complete lack of toxic masculine bullshit. it’s beyond refreshing and gives me strength to pay it forward to others. be kind y’all, especially to those who may be processing a crap ton of kavanaugh-induced stress. kindness means everything. #metoo #believesurvivors #loveiskind

text: beautiful and heartbreaking drawing from @leaheps. i’ve received a few texts and messages last night and this morning from my friends who are not doing well today. i’ve also seen too many posts from even more friends who are publicly not doing well. i just wanted to come here to say i’m not doing well either. the last couple days have opened too many old wounds up for me and so many other women. i’m sad, confused, angry, heartbroken, and visibly shaken. it’s so easy to feel as though there is no place in the world for us. again, i just wanted to reach out publicly and tell you how much i love you. and i’m here to support you and most importantly, i believe you. 🖤 #christineblaseyford #ibelieveher #stopkavanaugh #kavanope #believesurvivors #whyididntreport #metoo #iloveyou #timesup

text:
#metoo
#whyididntreport
#timesupnow
@timesupnow
i've been sharing my story for ten years but it took me 17years to share it. i'm not one to judge or prosecute the offenders. i'm simply here to experince life and to teach. 
as parents, it is out job to change the dialogue we share with our babies. 
i teach my kids about who is/isn't allowed to touch them and i teach them how to respect others. as they grow older our dialogue will get deeper. most people were never taught or corrected. i believe everyone is meant to experience life their own way but there comes a time when shifts happen because the energy pushing it- just. can't. hide. anymore.
please do not take away the voice of someone who's willing to share their story. after their dignity, pride, self esteem are striped away, typically all they have left is their voice. 
#metoomovement #isharebecauseicare #istandforchange #timesupmovement #timesup #meetoomvmt
#dreamdreamerceo #strongwoman #afrolatinamagic

text:
our emotional and other frustrating relationships with food are often a coping mechanism. ❌
..
for different people it takes different forms: 🔺we eat to stuff down emotions because we don’t want to feel. 🔺or we micro-manage our food trying to make ourselves small so that we don’t stand out. 🔺or we want to be small because we are trying to make ourselves attractive to be heard and significant. 🔺or we overeat so that we will have a layer of protection, to blend in.
..
not every person, but many people who struggle with food have suffered some sort of trauma, often a sexual trauma, that informs not only these coping mechanisms, but the way that we view ourselves, what we believe about ourselves and how we show up in the world.
..
this has been a hard week. hard to relive our own trauma through dr. ford’s recounting of hers, and hard to witness the debate and callousness with which it is received.
..
but your wounds are where the light can come in. ✨if you are struggling to grapple with a trauma, i am here for you, i believe you, and even if our country and our justice system won’t stand up for you, i will take a stand. ..
💫because i know that you can stand and shine in greatness no matter what has happened to you. and it is my life’s work to fight for your ability to overcome and to thrive.💫

text:
...currently swinging in my hammock, writing. do you know journaling/writing is a powerful tool for those on a healing journey (which we all have the opportunity to do, btw, b/c this world is broken)? there’s something beautiful about writing in a journal or on a computer screen. in regards to paper journals, i like to say, “the most stunning watercolor is a tear stained journal.” i started painting those kind of watercolors when i was ten & received my first journal. sometimes writing w/ a flashlight, under my covers, at times in an intense, smothering darkness. you know, to be honest, someone, who through a broken heart, chooses to keep writing & using her voice_is beyond stunning. exquisitely beautiful really. to keep sharing when no one believes you. you cannot fake that kind of depth (character) or honesty_in my experience & opinion. fellow survivors know that. so i say to fellow survivors or those hurting, even to the little girl inside of me, “you are beautiful. you are worth fighting for. i see your tears. i feel them. i even feel your broken heart_your utter exhaustion_and i am sorry for the rejection you have felt by not being seen, heard or validated, inside & outside of the church, government or family structure. i feel you drowning in pain & i offer you a hand. in all of it, i stand beside you & i sit beside you. i offer my shoulder to you. i commit to fight for you & with you_honorably & passionately_spirit, soul, & body. spiritually & systemically. you are loved.”
.
in a spirit of honesty, can i ask you something, if you have never experienced complex sexual or domestic trauma, would you consider volunteering at a local dv center? it will cultivate an empathy & compassion you might never know otherwise. we need it. our nation needs it. our churches need it. our survivors desperately need it. much love, me.
.
#tellyourstory #braveone #metoo #iamasurvivor #thereishope #bnwlife #bnwphoto #writersofinsta #ibelieveher

text:
how we choose to deal with our trauma is our choice.
.
the reasons why we did or did not come forward with our assault is no ones business but our own. there are countless more reasons i personally did not go forward with mine, and it pains me so much to feel the weight of the country’s judgment against the brave and heroic doctor christine blasey ford as to why she didn’t come forward sooner. even our own president is on twitter asking this.
.
if we don’t go forward we are blamed. if we do go forward we are called liars. i am disgusted. i am saddened. i am hurt.
.
listening to dr. ford’s opening statement, i couldn’t help but to relive my own experience. it is triggering for me because i was also assaulted at 15. i put myself in her shoes and i imagine what it must be like to not only relive all of it, but to do it in the public spotlight. i imagine if i had to answer questions about that awful night, and i don’t think i could. not just because of how difficult it would be, but because i have spent a long time trying to block out all of the memories from that time.
.
i stand here as a feminist. as a woman. as a survivor. as a human being. i stand with christine.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
#whyididntreport #yesallwomen #believesurvivors #webelievesurvivors #believechristine #cancelkavanaugh #wewontgoback #feminism #strongwomen #metoo #igyogacommunity #yogagirl #yogafam #drblaseyford #believewomen #womensrights #womenmatter #stopkavanaugh #kavanaughhearings #ihearyourvoice #womensupportwomen

text:
"redeeming eve". created in 2014.
.
yesterday i watched this amazing dance performance that i believe was on america's got talent. there was this whole battle of good & evil starting with the whole adam & eve narrative.
.
the performance was beautiful, i even watched it a few times. but i walked away frustrated. thinking adam should have taken responsibility & had eve's back. he should have upheld her & laid down his life for her.
.
in the end, most all of us know that women have been stepped over, abused, suppressed & tortured in countless ways.
.
if anything it has taught us to be strong, resourceful,  courageous, compassionate & wise.
.
and thankfully,  this story is not over. it's truly beginning, in my opinion.
.
during this part of "mankind's " history,  we arise from the shadows. from the ground. from our tears & we take our rightful places.
.
queens. leaders. visionaries. healers. bridge makers & warriors for justice!
.
the male patriarchy has had their chance & for thousands of years continues to rip apart our world, our families, our spirits, all for power.
.
and i feel a shift. eve is in the process of emancipating ourselves.  we take the platform & we will be heard. we will not stop. everything in our history has taught us what we need to truly rise into our true places of leadership.
.
the work is truly just beginning, but i have faith. we are the answer. thanks to other courageous women, like christine ford & anita hill. for all warrior women who have carved a path for us to contribute our steps to!
.
rise sisters,  rise!
it's our time!
pick up your crowns, let's do this shit!
the world is exploding with the need of: us.
us.
woman.
the key to everything.
👸🏽❤👸🏿❤👸🏻❤👸🏼❤👸❤👸🏾
.
for prints of "redeeming eve" follow the link in my bio. 🙏👑💛👸.
.
https://mandalasoulschoolblog.com/product/redeeming-eve-canvas-print/
.

text:
call your senators: republican script

it’s time to mobilize. need to impeach is circulating a script for calling your senator to oppose kavanaugh’s supreme court confirmation, but if you live in a swing state like i do, the script isn’t much help when you’re talking to a republican senate office.

lisamurkowski
sen. lisa murkowski (r-ak) is among four republican senators who seem the most likely to vote against brett kavanaugh. |drew angerer/getty images 
here’s what i plan to say when i call the republican senator my state:

i’m calling to urge senator [insert senator name] to vote no on brett kavanaugh’s confirmation.

brett kavanaugh’s appearance on september 27 made it clear that he doesn’t have the temperament required of a supreme court judge. as a woman and a voter in [your state], i found dr. blasey ford’s testimony to be convincing and credible, and i am in support of an fbi investigation.

however, whatever the results of the fbi investigation may be, i believe that kavanaugh perjured himself yesterday. regardless of whether you believe dr. blasey ford, he has shown himself to be a liar with no regard for the process or the laws.

in addition, i’m deeply troubled by mr. kavanaugh’s positions on the protections afforded to people with pre-existing conditions guaranteed by the affordable care act. he does not appear to be in favor of american indian tribes’ rights, something that is important to me as a voter.

not only this, kavanaugh believes that sitting presidents should be exempt from criminal prosecution and investigation. if senator [name] is in favor of this, as a concerned citizen, i will work to make sure that [he/she/they] will not serve another term as an elected official in my state.

can i count on the senator to vote no against brett kavanaugh?

to make your call, click here to be connected with need to impeach, which offers a prompt that will connect you to your senator’s office.

is there anything you’d add to this script? please leave it in the comments. @turn_pa_blue #metoo #vote #votenoonkavanaugh

text:
you have to accept and understand that there is a problem in order to fix it. if you believe the word is equal i’d like to open your eyes a little... •women with full time jobs still earn only about 77% of their male counterparts earnings. •african-american women earn 64cents and latina women earn 56cents for every $1 earned by a caucasian man. •62million girls are denied an education all over the world. #upforschool •every year 15million girls under the age of 18 are married worldwide with little or no say in the matter. •4 out of 5 victims of human trafficking are women •30% of women that have been in a relationship have reported physical or sexual violence from their partner. •until recently, women in saudi arabia weren’t allowed to drive and are still discouraged from working jobs that put them in the same category as men. the unemployment rate for women is 33% and for men is 7%. •it is more common for a woman between the age of 15-44 to have experienced rape or domestic violence than cancer, car accidents, war or malaria. •1 in 5 women in an american college campus have reported experiencing sexual assault. 
i’m not saying that men don’t experience any of this because they do. i’m just trying to make a difference and help people understand #metoo #bekind #equality #payrights #loveyourself #respectwomen #respectmen #feminist #feminism 💜

text:
to #drchristineblaseyford for courageously sharing her story yesterday, this flower is for you.

to every woman who felt a pit in their stomach as they watched #christineblaseyford in empathy, this flower is for you. 
to every woman who’s pulse quickened with painful recognition of a survivors story, this flower is for you. 
to every woman who revisited their own history with sexual assault as this country boiled in a he-said-she-said debate that felt all too close to home, this flower is for you. 
to every man who loves a woman that is a survivor and the heartbreak that comes with watching their trauma bubble up and resurface, this flower is for you. 
to every parent of young boys who lay awake at night hoping that they are emulating empathy and respect in a way that will carry them through their lives.  and to every parent of young girls who lay awake at night knowing the daunting statistics in this country against women, this flower is for you. 
for our divided country and the great divide of hurt that needs to be bridged, this flower is for you. ***** i debated sharing this today.  yes, this is a wellness feed and i like to keep this space positive and uplifting.  yet, events this week were deeply felt for me and i know for so many others.  and because wellness is a culmination of our mental and physical health this felt more than relevant to share today. 
be gentle with yourself and each other.  if you need support, please call #rainn: 800-656-hope xx

#maternalmentalhealth #mentalhealthmatters #believesurvivors #metoo #timesup #stopkavanaugh  #stopvictimblaming #speakyourtruth #whyididntreport

text:
happy friday, warriors! it's #freeyourmindfriday which means we're featuring @ritzawonderfullife who's sharing her story and taking over ours today! here, she shares her real, raw, and touching story. 💚 6 sexual traumas. 5 antidepressants. 4 therapists. 3 suicide attempts. 3 diagnoses. 2 involuntary hospitalizations. 2 psychiatrists. 1 residential inpatient program. too many cuts on my body. too many panic attacks. too much dissociation. i have suffered from depression and anxiety for as long as i can remember.  i never really thought anything of the social anxiety, the wanting to die or the idea that everything would be easier if i was no longer alive.  my family raised me to believe i was too strong to feel any of this, and that i could get through anything without bringing attention to this.  i was raised to believe that i should never wear too revealing clothes, always be aware of my surroundings and never be the only female in a group.  i never thought it was ok to be weak or sad, what i thought was weakness.

here i was, 24 years old, one unnoticed suicide attempt and another attempt that i was later hospitalized for, and i felt at my lowest again.  talk therapy, cbt, trauma specific talk therapy and tms and i was still feeling hopeless.  my therapist recommended emdr, but felt i should go through my treatment on an inpatient basis.  i was scared and ashamed of having to be hospitalized and going to a residential program.  i had never voluntarily admitted myself.  i knew i needed this program the day news came out that kate spade had died. i was planning on ending my life...💚link in blog to her full story. if you’re a #mentalhealthblogger that’s wants to share, please send us a pm.
.
.
.
#fridayfeels #survivor #warrior #trauma #recovery #treatment #mentalhealth #depression #anxiety #ptsd #suicideawareness #suicideprevention #shareyourstory #tellyourtruth #setyourselffree #savelives #stopthestigma #endthestigma #youarenotalone #stay #hereforyou #tomorrowneedsyou #believeher #metoo

text: #ibelieveyou #metoo #workplaceharrassment
name: Ina
tweet_full: #ibelieveyou #metoo #workplaceharrassment

text:
my #metoo #ibelieveyou #supportsurvivors posts are not a ‘shot at men’, ‘fueled by feminism’ or ‘to intimidate the male population’. i post to spread awareness for survivors & victims of both genders. i post so maybe an abuser will think twice about their violence being a “private” issue. 
it’s hard to understand these situations when you’ve never been in one. it’s hard to explain why you stayed, why you didn’t report it, how you don’t have proof, how you loved someone who was capable of those things. if you have ever been pushed so low by someone you held so high, you understand. you understand that even though we hear these statistics, we hear other women coming forward, it still feels lonely. shameful. embarrassing.

but you are not alone. you hear me?
y o u  a r e  n o t  a l o n e .

i’ve shared my story to many people, on many platforms & occasions. most of it. i can count on one hand how many people know just how dark my story gets & the lengths i’d gone to to protect my abusers. because after all this time, it’s still hard. some day, i might be more open. and guess what? if i am, i’ll have people asking me:
•why are you just now telling us?
•did you report it then?
•can you prove it?
& my favorite, “i just don’t understand...” you don’t have to understand. you just have to support them & be there. you have to show these survivors that they aren’t alone. chances are, their abuser has told them more than once that “nobody will believe you”. don’t let the abuser be right. you have to come together to support these brave people who are finally taking the reigns back in their life & seeking comfort.  you can’t change what happened, but your reaction, your support will help them move forward. that is why we are using our voices to put faces you know to the cause of domestic violence.
#ibelieveyou #metoo #supportsurvivors

& my favorite, “i just don’t understand...” you don’t have to understand. you just have to support them & be there. you have to show these survivors that they aren’t alone. chances are, their abuser has told them more than once that “nobody will believe you”. don’t let the abuser be right. you have to come together to support these brave people who are finally taking the reigns back in their life & seeking comfort.  you can’t change what happened, but your reaction, your support will help them move forward. that is why we are using our voices to put faces you know to the cause of domestic violence.
#ibelieveyou #metoo #supportsurvivors
pre_proc_tweet:
my    posts are not a ‘shot at men’, ‘fueled by feminism’ or ‘to intimidate the male population’. i post to spread awareness for survivors & victims of both genders. i post so maybe an abuser will think twice about their violence being a “private” issue. 
it’s hard to understand these situations when you’ve never been in one. it’s hard to explain why you stayed, why you didn’t repo it, how you don’t have proof, how you loved someone who was capable of those things. if you have ever been pushed so low by someone you held so high, you understand. you understand that even though we hear these statistics, we hear other women coming forward, it still feels lonely. shameful. embarrassing.

but you are not alone. you hear me?
y o u  a r e  n o t  a l o n e .

i’ve shared my story to many people, on many platforms & occasions. most of it. i can count on one hand how many people know just how dark my story gets & the lengths i’d gone to to protect my abusers. because after all this time, it’s still hard. some day, i might be more open. and guess what? if i am, i’ll have people asking me:
•why are you just now telling us?
•did you repo it then?
•can you prove it?
& my favorite, “i just don’t understand...” you don’t have to understand. you just have to suppo them & be there. you have to show these survivors that they aren’t alone. chances are, their abuser has told them more than once that “nobody will believe you”. don’t let the abuser be right. you have to come together to suppo these brave people who are finally taking the reigns back in their life & seeking comfo.  you can’t change what happened, but your reaction, your suppo will help them move forward. that is why we are using our voices to put faces you know to the cause of domestic violence.

text: the past two days have been immensely triggering for every sexual assault and rape survivor standing with dr. christine blasey ford. over the past two years of the #metoo movement, i’ve seen immense strength in women finding their voices and sacrificing their privacy in order to demand change. i’ve seen warriors reclaiming their power while fighting to protect the power of women to come. now, as brett kavanaugh’s nomination moves forward, i demand to know when our government will hold moral standards for the citizens of this country. first a president accused of sexual assault and now a supreme court nominee? when will our voices matter? when with the voices of women be enough? #believechristine #believewomen #cancelkavanaugh #istandwithher #webelievesurvivors #metoo #female #thankyouchristine #survivor #femalepower

text:
concerns...
(let the fbi investigation begin)
"we're watching history unfold, in a raw and urgent way. a retiring republican senator, jeff flake dramatically changes the trajectory of a supreme court nomination as his sometime foil/potus looks on from 1600. a majority leader instantly cornered and facing the q: plow forward or not? now, mcconnell has to figure out whether he can somehow get collins and murkowski to agree to a vote soon. but top sources say that's unlikely. so the next week becomes another pressure cooker as both sides debate/bicker over the scope over whatever steps are taken by the fbi. flake is a complicated figure. his friends say he's trying to protect gop and the court by making sure the fbi box is checked, and they think if kavanaugh emerges fine from that, he may even win over some red state ds.. but other rs argue flake knows he's all but dooming the nomination." - robert costa
so, we will start next week as we started this one: expecting a rosenstein meeting and a kavanaugh vote.

text_retweet:
i’m still trapped in my rapists bed while they all walk free, all because my stepbrother threatened to tell his father that i had pissed in the woods.
-
i grew up in a hunting family in the ozark mountains.
-
pissing in the woods was something that everyone did, yet it would have earned me a severe beating by my new stepfather.
-
i knew this because in the first three months of their marriage, he’d shot my pet poodle in a show of dominance.
-
3 decades later, i still pray that they’ve found redemption, even though i remain shackled by the chains that they forged.
-
i may never be free, but i hope that they are.
-
-
-
please tag friends, like, comment and repost. i’d appreciate it very much.
-
check out my blog, the link is in my bio
-
-
-

text:
working with trauma was never on the top shelf of things i wanted to commit my life to. i have always seen myself more of a #fightergirl and an activist for those that could not fight for themselves. so in a way, my work does just that. helps fight against the worst abuse, the one we inflict on ourselves. .
.
.
and the thing here is...i remember 1982 - and i remember that year so vividly as a survivor of 3 incidents that by then were shaping my life view. those were not the last, but they were the worst. i was 9 years old. timid. afraid. quiet. anxious. chewed my nails. already the self hate talks were happening in my head because i was blaming myself for it all. i had experienced so much emotional trauma. so by the time i was 16 and 17, i was confused and depressed and lost. .
.
.
in light of the triggers that are occurring across the country today, i am forever grateful that i was able to rise above the abuse. that it does not define me but it does not stop me from feeling the pain of others who have been through less or more than i did and still carry that pain so heavily. #compassion walks along with some #bitterrage today. .
.
you’re not alone. the awareness that is sweeping the world right now with the #divinefemininerising is real. i say this often but today, seriously, lean in. we need each other. like @mariannewilliamson said today, we are coming. i believe that in my heart. women are #ridiculouslypowerful and the men that support us are equally as strong. keep moving forward and support our women candidates that will be rising from the ashes. i believe you.❣️#phoenixrising .
.
.
.
#ibelievehertoo #stopkavanaugh #notfit #womensmarch #professorford #metoo

text:
a few months ago, we were at a park. there was this young girl next to us with an adult man. she was on her tip toes trying to see over the gate, so he kneeled down and asked “is it okay if i pick you up?” she said “yes”, and i felt hope.
.
consent is taught when you give a human permission to own their body, regardless of age.
.
to my friends healing from incidents that happened to you over half your life ago, you are not alone. to my friends who are finally able to speak about what happened to you, you have a voice. to my friends who aren’t ready to share yet, i’m here when you’re ready. .
to my friends struggling to believe someone’s story, think of 5 women you know. one of them is a victim of rape. one in four girls and one in six boys are the victim of sexual abuse. (https://www.nsvrc.org/statistics). our reactions to their stories matter.
.
we have to change the conversations we have. we have to be proactive. we have to use proper terminology. we have to teach consent. we have to empower others to have permission over their own body and only their body. we have to vulnerably and without judgement listen to the stories when someone is brave enough to speak up. we have the power to change. be the change. 
with love, #nattig 💕

text:
trigger warning ⚠️ .
.
not much to say over what is happening over women’s bodies in the media lately
.
.
other than this:
.
.
it’s not rape
.
.
it’s not rape
if he’s your boyfriend, after all you enjoy having sex with him

it’s not rape
if you’ve been drinking, you really should be more careful

it’s not rape
if your clothes stay on, let’s be honest, nothing really happened

it’s not rape
if you’re uncovered, sensual, or pretty - you can’t expect him to control himself

it’s not rape
if you started it, but still beg him to stop

it’s not rape 
if he’s a minor - boys will be boys

it’s not rape
if you failed to report it - i mean, if it was that bad why didn’t you tell someone?

it’s not rape
if its his hand, his fist, or an object

it’s not rape 
if he doesn’t force his penis inside of you

even if you are bruised, bleeding, and broken
it’s not rape
.
.

so i bury the memories in the back of my mind
hide the hurt in the dim recesses of my dismembered soul
locking them up in the dark - never letting them see the light of day
.
.

but like a nightmare
they resurface
time
and 
time again
.
.

i look in the mirror 
to the hurting girl within
she’s begging me to speak up
she’s urging me to roar
with a sinking in my stomach
i meet her gaze
smiling into her eyes
i dismiss her cries
it’s not rape
i tell her
it’s not rape
