text:
we are all on the edge of a razor blade, can you feel it?

as a woman i’ve grown up seeing many moments in history where we’ve gotten close to finally flipping all of the abuse that patriarchy creates for women (and men too because patriarchy is harmful for them too & traumatic for all of us). and then at the last minute i’ve watched the patriarchy win. i got used to this being the outcome, while letting rage fuel me to be strong and speak up. 
i, like most of us, have watched repeatedly as women have been disbelieved, silenced, shamed and ridiculed into oblivion again. 
i’ve watched as priests protect child abusers within an entire religious institution for decades. 
i’ve watched a world where rapists serve no jail time. 
where a black man can be shot and nothing is done. 
or a man can kneel for justice and be banned for an entire year from playing.

watching the toxic status quo win, over & over again. it feels like, collectively, this has been our experience more than not. 
each time we bury screams of rage deeper into our heart. seek refuge in each other & we wait. we wait for the reckoning to come. 
and then #metoo happened. 
and i felt an old hope flare up inside of me again.  that young girl within who watched goodness lose repeatedly, wondered if this is the moment so many of us have been waiting for, for centuries.

we’re in this space that appears before large shifts— the void. where we are blind & cannot know the outcome.

will we finally get to build a new world together where more people are seen, heard, loved, respected, treated with equal dignity and respect regardless of their sex, gender, orientation, color, body size, or physical ability?

we don’t know what will happen. 
if we go back to the old we know how to survive and will keep surviving. that i know. we are strong. 
but i also know i grew up watching a dictator slowly take over my country. i remember the dark times when it seemed as if we would never recover or see our way out of this.

but that day did come. and that man went to jail. 
i keep thinking how sometimes, it takes a while, but justice always comes. veils always fall. and truth always, always, always comes out.
_

text:
this resonates so deeply within me. i watched with the rest of the country as dr. christine blasey ford, a victim of sexual assault, came forward & bravely shared her story. many of us; compassionate humans, concerned citizens and victims ourselves, watched as this woman eloquently & visibly traumatized, recounted the events of her assault. 
dr. blasey ford is a hero, speaking her truth for the betterment of our country. 
i have, on a much smaller scale, done the same.

the experience of sharing my truth was perhaps even more traumatizing as the initial abuse. my character was questioned & i was vilified in ways i am not ready to relive. 
how we show up & support victims of sexual crimes is imperative to their/our healing. 
my saving grace; my parents, brothers & grandmother. their belief in me disburdened a lot of the shame that i carried. i did not have to provide facts, prove my abuse, recount the events of my trauma, they just believed me. that was an enormous part of my healing.  #webelievesurvivors #ibelieve #believesurvivors #ibelievechristine #metoo
name: Patty Joy
tweet_full:
this resonates so deeply within me. i watched with the rest of the country as dr. christine blasey ford, a victim of sexual assault, came forward & bravely shared her story. many of us; compassionate humans, concerned citizens and victims ourselves, watched as this woman eloquently & visibly traumatized, recounted the events of her assault. 
dr. blasey ford is a hero, speaking her truth for the betterment of our country. 
i have, on a much smaller scale, done the same.

the experience of sharing my truth was perhaps even more traumatizing as the initial abuse. my character was questioned & i was vilified in ways i am not ready to relive. 
how we show up & support victims of sexual crimes is imperative to their/our healing. 
my saving grace; my parents, brothers & grandmother. their belief in me disburdened a lot of the shame that i carried. i did not have to provide facts, prove my abuse, recount the events of my trauma, they just believed me. that was an enormous part of my healing.  #webelievesurvivors #ibelieve #believesurvivors #ibelievechristine #metoo

text:
shining your light isn’t hard, it’s igniting it. 
it’s the act of creating a brightness and warmth within the dark cold that is difficult. 
our world can be shadowed at times and it’s easy to stay here and let hopelessness  reign. in these moments, do the hard thing. grab what you can, do what you can to create a spark, which will make the flame and cast the shadows away. 
and then let that flame shine for the world to see. 
#metoo #christinebaselyford #listen #nipomo #nipomoyoga #handstand #fridayfunday #shineon #yogashine #iloveyoga

text:
today's #naplengthstudiotime consists of camisole, spring coat, embroidery floss, and pregnancy pillow stuffing. .
.
i spent a large portion of my studio time with the streaming of the vote for kavanaugh on in the background. i don't know if i currently have the words for how angry i am. i can feel it, at my center, like lava, moving its way to all points of my body. i can feel it in my chest- the tightening. as others have said, it is now not about believing but about caring. showing that was has happened to dr. ford matters, that what has happened to many of us matters. hearing many of the senators talk afterward, saying this changes nothing for them, that they are more certain than ever that the confirmation will go through... i want to be surprised but i am not. this is the system that we live in and it must change. .
.
.
the chapter i did have was short and pertinent, as is much of the text in #motherreader "if the woman artist has been trained to believe that the activities of motherhood are trivial, tangential to main issues of life, irrelevant to the great themes of literature, she should untrain herself. the training is misogynist, it protects and perpetuates systems of thought and feeling which prefer violence and death to love and birth and it is a lie". – alicia ostriker ‘a wild surmise: motherhood and poetry (1983)’ from mother reader
.
.
#arim #artistresidencyinmotherhood #art #artist #mother #motherhood #softsculpture #smallsculpture #sewing #naplengthstudiotime #motherartist #artistmother #mothermaker #acreativedc #tenderobjects #empoweredwomenempowerwomen #womenartists #femaleartists #artistresidency  #metoo
name: Sarah Dolan
tweet_full:
today's #naplengthstudiotime consists of camisole, spring coat, embroidery floss, and pregcy pillow stuffing. .
.
i spent a large portion of my studio time with the streaming of the vote for kavanaugh on in the background. i do not know if i currently have the words for how angry i am. i can feel it, at my center, like lava, moving its way to all points of my body. i can feel it in my chest- the tightening. as others have said, it is now not about believing but about caring. showing that was has happened to dr. ford matters, that what has happened to many of us matters. hearing many of the senators talk afterward, saying this changes nothing for them, that they are more certain than ever that the confirmation will go through... i want to be surprised but i am not. this is the system that we live in and it must change. .
.
.
the chapter i did have was short and pertinent, as is much of the text in #motherreader "if the woman artist has been trained to believe that the activities of motherhood are trivial, tangential to main issues of life, irrelevant to the great themes of literature, she should untrain herself. the training is misogynist, it protects and perpetuates systems of thought and feeling which prefer violence and death to love and birth and it is a lie". – alicia ostriker ‘a wild surmise: motherhood and poetry (1983)’ from mother reader
.
.
#arim #artistresidencyinmotherhood #art #artist #mother #motherhood #softsculpture #smallsculpture #sewing #naplengthstudiotime #motherartist #artistmother #mothermaker #acreativedc #tenderobjects #empoweredwomenempowerwomen #womenartists #femaleartists #artistresidency  #metoo

#ibelieveher #believesurvivors #metoo

text: anyone else have an emotional hangover from yesterday? so many feelings coming to the surface & reactions to others reactions & also, maybe some surprise over how visceral some personal responses were. i hope we’re all taking care of ourselves today. i shared some uncomfortable stuff in my stories yesterday. it surprised me that i did b/c i really didn’t mean to .. just started writing & then the messages from friends i received about it let me know that that is why we share. support is kind of an awesome feeling. sending extra love to all of you beautiful people & i hope we can all keep connecting. 💚

text:
oh my sweet girl,
i hope things change for you and your generation.
i get down on my knees and pray that you do not become 1 out of 6.
i hope for a future of well raised boys and supportive, protective men. 
i pray for truth and i pray for justice. 
that we no longer feel afraid walking to our cars alone at night, that we don’t feel the need change out of an outfit because people don’t know how to keep their hands to themselves or how to take responsibility for their actions. 
i hope for a judicial system that thinks about their daughters just as much as they think about their men of power. 
i hope that you never have a story to tell but if you do, know that even if they don’t believe you, i believe you.

text:
and i care about her #christineblaseyford • i didn’t post yesterday because i was so triggered and drained by following the news. but it’s important to talk and share. the shame i carry around my sexual abuse still makes it something i don’t talk about to most people in my life. i cannot yet imagine sharing the details of my abuse publicly even among the community of fuxking badass magical witches womxn and freaks here on ig. but #metoo • in the face of the trauma i carry, i work every day to reclaim my wholeness, my value, and my right to love and trust my body. every day. every survivor is a warrior. whatever the outcome of this event, dr. ford’s strength and bravery will never be lost. her decision strengthens every one of our journeys.
•
white male supremacy is a foul and murderous disease. this nation is built on it. watching the news right now is trauma-heavy. call your senators but please also take care of yourselves taking all of this in. respect your process and your bodies. the revolution is here, too. i love you all.
•
#fuckkavanaugh #witchesofinstagram #survivor #empowersurvivors #selfcare #trauma #abuse #warrior #staygentle and #stayangry #respect #love

text:
i wish @milano_alyssa was a real witch, and @realdonaldtrump wasn’t a dumb bitch. a poem for friday.
🖤
in a world where a woman has to stand before a jury (of mostly men) and defend herself by reliving the terror of sexual assault in order for them to not give the assailant one of the most prestigious/important/honorable jobs on the planet, i proudly stand up and say, “time is up.” for every man, woman, and child... for every friend, family member, or acquaintance... for everyone who has experienced sexual assault, just know that we have your back and we will fight to make sure wrongdoings do not go unpunished. #metoo #timesup #stopkavanaugh #christineblaseyford #ibelieve #believewomen #texasdemocrats #arizonademocrats #alyssamilano #charmed

text:
we are experiencing such an opportunity for healing in our country right now. everyone is wounded and the trauma is right up on the surface. as an empath — i literally feel every vibration move through my body — it’s been a rough week. but feeling it is part of the process, facing the truth is another step and then releasing in forgiveness because we are all one. and no—forgiveness does not involve letting scared humans with a consciousness just one step up from the animal kingdom hurt us any longer. it’s time for higher levels of awareness and consciousness—-and the meek shall inherit the earth.
.
.

text:
abuse comes in many forms it can be verbal, emotional, mental, financial these are forms of abuse that some people do not recognize right away because they aren’t physical so they are overlooked and you just feel crazy!
.
control, intimidation, isolation, extreme jealousy, monitoring your phone, social media, whereabouts are all forms of abuse and once you allow these to continue it will more than likely escalate to physical abuse. even if it never becomes physical a person who has no respect for your personal boundaries and continually makes you feel like you are not good enough is toxic and abusive and you need to get away from them for your safety and sanity!
.
never hesitate to point out to a friend or family member that you see something that appears to be abusive because often times when you are in it you can’t see it and if they are being mentally abused it’s even more difficult for them to recognize!
.
.
.
.
.

text:
warning: this is kind of lengthy and it's of a sensitive nature. 
yesterday was horrible. 
watching dr. ford testify yesterday, and the "but i'm the victim *wahh wahh wahh* from kavanaugh, unleashed a flood of horrible memories for me. if you've ever been sexually assaulted, raped or both, as i have, you know exactly what i am talking about. 
the way the gop coddled the blubbering, whining kavanaugh was nothing short of disgusting. it's unconscionable that he would be treated as a victim in this case. he simply isn't. 
and they wonder why so many sexual assaults and rapes don't get reported. 😐
it's hard enough to admit that you've literally been forced to endure horrific events, but when the one who put you through then is the one who gets treated like the victim, that is beyond disgusting. it discourages survivors from reporting.
i believe dr. ford. i stand with ll of my fellow survivors, and that will never change.
if you're reading this and you have gone through it, i hope you know that you're not alone and you matter!
reach out if you need to. 💖
.
.
.
.
.
#stopkavanaugh #sexualassault #rape #survivorsnotvictims #metoo #wehavetosticktogether #support #thisisdifficult #strongertogether

pre_proc_tweet:
warning: this is kind of lengthy and it is of a sensitive nature. 
yesterday was horrible. 
watching dr. ford testify yesterday, and the "but i am the victim *wahh wahh wahh* from kavanaugh, unleashed a flood of horrible memories for me. if you have ever been sexually assaulted, raped or both, as i have, you know exactly what i am talking about. 
the way the gop coddled the blubbering, whining kavanaugh was nothing sho of disgusting. it is unconscionable that he would be treated as a victim in this case. he simply is not. 
and they wonder why so many sexual assaults and rapes do not get repoed. 😐
it is hard enough to admit that you have literally been forced to endure horrific events, but when the one who put you through then is the one who gets treated like the victim, that is beyond disgusting. it discourages survivors from repoing.
i believe dr. ford. i stand with ll of my fellow survivors, and that will never change.
if you are reading this and you have gone through it, i hope you know that you are not alone and you matter!
reach out if you need to. 💖
.
.
.
.
.

text:
ladies and gentlemen, yesterday we were a witness to a man whose behavior is irrational. 
combative. whiny. unreasonable. 
is this the type of "leader" we want in the #whitehouse? sure, let's add one more #nut (being nice)  to this administration who continually challenges our perception of sanity. 
if so, we would be welcoming lousy behavior. 
we would keep alienating women and regard them as second-class citizens. 
so when is enough—enough?  how many more #metoo movements or #stopkavanaugh moments must women endure? 
is this the ‘best’ we can do? 
women are angry, and we have every right to be. 
this woman's testimony is important. valid. eye-opening. 
listen to the ‘other' side. 
listen to those whose voices have been silenced. 
listen to her.
above all, be human.
.
.
.
from the words of robert kennedy:
"when we tolerate what we know to be wrong, when we close our eyes and ears to the corrupt because we are too busy or too frightened when we fail to speak up and speak out, we strike a blow against freedom and decency and justice.”
#believesurvivors  #whyisthisamerica #dumptrump #imwithher #ibelieveher #justice #istandwithford #whiteprivilege #patriarchy #truth #survivors #drblaseyford #christineblaseyford #humanrights #womenrights #tellingthetruth #vulnerabilityisstrength

text_retweet:
i don't repost often however this needed a repost!

as a survivor and a supporter of the #metoo movement you can bet i watched the hearing yesterday.

i'll keep most of my thoughts to myself however i was appalled by what i saw. as a sitting judge his behavior was abhorrent.

disgraceful behavior by kavanaugh! all that pent up anger. way too defensive. not a good look for someone who is supposed to be a level headed, fair minded, ethical judge!

just so we are clear, i used to be a staunch republican who on occasion voted across party lines. after the mccain/palen debacle i became an independent.
so for me this truly isn't a republican/democratic issue. this is a moral issue. this is about closet abusers and closet victims, everyone running scared. scared someone will find out your truth. scared you'll have to own up to your behavior. 
everyone needs to get the hell out of the closet, cuz it's busting at the seams! 
#metoo #survivor #victim #disgraceful #kavanaugh #republican #democratic #debacle @rachelmaddowshow @politicsnation @arimelber

text:
thank you dr. ford for your grace, strength and personal sacrifice. your vulnerability is contagious. the way in which you stood up for yourself, spoke your truth and gracefully stood in your power was otherworldly. you disrupted the patriarchy at its core, awakening some inflated ego's... their sexism was seeping through their every word. it was a bittersweet experience to witness... in order to create change we must face our deepest, darkest truths... our collective consciousness is deeeeep in the midst of opening old wounds as we work our way through some gruesome systemic trauma.

to all the survivors out there,  remember that you are loved and supported, always. and please remember to be kind to yourself, it was not your fault and this is not normal.

no words to describe my emotions during this past week.  dr. ford has inspired me beyond belief...i think it's time i share my truth...

text:
i think it’s time i share a more in-depth explanation of my pursuit and purpose as a creative. for as long as i can remember i have always been passionate about making art in what ever form it’s taken. which all include painting, sculpting, make up, writing poetry, crafting, acting/film, event organizing, dancing, singing/making music, and of course modeling. the name “creative comet” essentially means that i am a fiery traveler of artistic mediums. i bounce from one form of expression to the next depending on what feels right in the moment. 
with much reflection, i’ve learned that creating art has never been about doing it ”the right way” but goes so much deeper for me. it was always a way for me to cope through my struggles when i was young and as i’ve gotten older it has been a way for me to cultivate healing from my inner woundings and trauma. it has become a safe way for me to be totally vulnerable in creatively expressing my story with others. making art is a personal healing journey but in turn i truly hope it can help heal others as well. my goal is and has always been to encourage others to honor their emotions and if i can accomplish that with what i make then i’m doing it right! all too often have we been shamed for having emotions of anger, or sadness, or depression etc. 
our society equates it to being weak! so we can’t have them. but please understand that this does us more harm than good. when we ignore and resist the stuff that desperately wants to be felt we are hurting ourselves in the long run. so please if art can be a way to get those things out use it! making art has saved my life! 
from the bottom of my heart i want to thank all of you for your endless support! it means the world to me!
📸: @unrestricted_blacksmith #modelsofinstagram #photography #artismedicine #vulnerable #speakyourtruth #mentalhealthawareness #metoo #emotions #anger #hate #shame #guilt #grief #trauma #depression #insecure #anxiety #ptsd #hope #belief #courage #bravery #beauty #care #kindness #compassion #passion #love #selfawareness #selfcare

text:
any survivors out there struggling the past few days? wondering why decades of talk therapy isn't working? still struggling with flashbacks/panic attacks/anxiety? msg me if you need someone to talk to <3

this book is mandatory reading! go get it right now. they have it at your local library. maybe even in ebook format straight from your phone. this book saved my life. i would be dead right now if i never found this book. it shows you the real path to recovering from trauma. 
going to talk therapy and being forced to recount your trauma in play by play details is not helpful. but it will probably cause you to have more flashbacks. there is real treatment that can help you.
.
.
.

text:
no one wants to be in this position, no one asks to be in this position, they put on their armour take on this position with bravery and go to battle for every woman who has suffered at the hands of a man.
they do not do it for monetary reasons, they do not do it for social gain, they do it for every woman that does not feel safe enough to speak up, they do it to break the silence, they do it to move society forwards and they do it for themselves.
thank you to professor anita gill and dr. christine blasey ford for being a voice for women. ⠀

a counselor is always available offering crisis intervention, counseling, referrals, support and information. you are welcome to call if you have been sexually assaulted or abused, or if you are a family member, friend, or service provider of a survivor. 
if you are deaf or hard of hearing, you can reach us directly using a video phone or tty during business hours or by using the massachusetts relay service 24-hours. 
vp: (508)852-7681 (m-f 9am-5pm)
tty: (888)887-7130(m-f 9am-5pm)
ma tty relay service: 711
multi-language access: through collaboration with the at&t language line, we provide interpreters for the hotline in more than 150 languages. #glorifythis #pathwaysforchange #believesurvivors #metoo #timesup

text: thank you to all the women who showed up @1440multiversity to take my spirit speak training. now, more than ever, we need to find our voice, step into leadership, engage our community and call in all our guides for inspiration and guidance. i’ve been immersed in this training, but not so much that i’m unaware of what’s been going down at the hearings. it was a demonstration of patriarchy and misogyny and sickened me to my core. sadly, this misogyny lives within all of us in both subtle and overt ways. for us to change it we must work hard to acknowledge it, see the ways it influences our choices, and then heal it. accountability will always be key. i’m grateful that i got to spend this week encouraging women to take seriously their role as leaders and to do the inner work necessary so that we can dismantle these biased and archaic institutions (both external and internal) and create a world that is just, and reflects human nature at it’s best and most self-realized. i’m praying for #drchristineblaseyford and for all the women who speak out, and for those who can’t. #endthepatriarchy #ibelieveyou #metoo #nokavanaugh #spiritspeak #endviolenceagainstwomen

text: given what has happened in the last 24 hours of us news, i need a little love and beauty today to counteract some of the ugly. as a distraction, i started editing some of my photos from austin and found this little gem that my hubby took of two things he loves -- me and coffee. something about this photo stood out to me and brought me a small amount of joy. it is hard for me to see the light at the end of the tunnel today, and maybe there is no light at the end of this tunnel; but, there is light in my life and love in my life and i guess that's all we can really hope for to help us get through tough days. i feel so grateful that i have a respectful, loving and feminist husband because right now, i'm not feeling super thrilled with men. he reminds me that there are good ones out there who believe and support women ❤ #ibelievechristineblaseyford #metoo

text:
she creates ✨
i thought of.this piece.today as i try to.find ease in the midst of the madness. it reminds me.to.breathe and.center as i work through feelings of anger and what jennifer so well describes as a deep ancestral rage!! yesterday, i opened up about my rape.experiences in my private fb group. it took me.all.day to write the post and press.the "post"  button. but i did. and although the rape part may be shocking enough ... what i do hope is understood in my situation and.in.others too, the worst.part is not being believed.  not being believed is traumatizing. it is a physical rape. then a heart rape. 
jennifer berezan wrote:

women and friends of women...how many of you are feeling a deep and ancient rage this morning? a bone deep fury as every memory of every abuse large and small re-sufaces in the mind and heart. this is a holy fury. a rage born from our love for ourselves and for justice. the image of lindsay graham screaming at diane feinstein as she sat quietly, head bowed is beyond disturbing. it's time to scream back at these privileged condescending men in the senate.... a mighty cry for justice is gathering... standing with you all today....and in november. throw them out.

#throwthemout
#metoo
oil on canvas #wip .

text: om gam ganapataye namaha ♥️ times like these shake our foundations and pull at our hearts.  although we grieve and suffer for ourselves and for every other victim, we must not hold on to just that. by staying here in the guilt and sadness, we bring more sorrow into our world. keep loving hard. never give up the good fight.  feel the empathetic part of your heart, but keep going. raise the vibration of your thoughts and actions. love harder. teach goodness and love to others. keep going. jesus and the beatles both said, “all you need is love.” love harder. keep going.

text: at this very time, two years ago, the last assault began. this is a day i doubt i will ever forget as it has changed my life in so many ways. getting out was hard and i had to give up many things, but i still have my life. while every day is a struggle, it was totally worth it. if i can help at least one person get out of their bad situation, my own dv/sa situation won’t hurt as much. at least i can use my bad experience for something positive. please #educateyourself and #educateothers. dv/sa can happen to anyone and it is more than just #physicalviolence and #rape. #economicabuse and #emotionalabuse are very real and a major problem. btw, rape can and does happen between spouses more than you want to believe. #believesurvivors i will never forget the horrible treatment i received from the cops because they thought this was just some “run of the mill assault.” that in itself is a tragedy. it was amazing and really kind of sad how their whole perspective changed once the rape kit was complete. i hope no other woman has to be shamed like that. no wonder people #dontreport. #domesticviolence and #sexualassault comes in many shapes and forms. #metoo #safetyplan #beavoice #fvpsa #enddv #endsa #supportsurvivors #abusiverelationship #gethelp #casfv

text: late night rehearsals in the ballroom. my #metoomovement vikings act is slowly coming together. i’ve wanted to show my solidarity and my support of the #metoomovement, and was inspired by musical artist netta barzilai and her eurovision winning song “toy”. not entirely sure if my political piece will get through to the audience, but i’m doing it anyways. for those who have experienced sexual harassment and sexual assault, me included. next month will be the debut of the act but there is so much more fine tuning to be done. #friskyfreya #fuckkavanaugh #ibelieveher #metoo #nettatoy #yukonclassic #politicalburlesque #istandwithher #nettabarzilai #vikings #goddessfreyadonttakenoshit

text_retweet:
the last few days/weeks/months/year have been tough, especially for survivors. the revelations of the #metoo movement (that were old news to so many of us but were finally being heard) and now the horror that is playing out in the states with brett kavanaugh's nomination are a lot for anyone to process, particularly women, and particularly survivors. 
we are here for you, we are with you, we believe you. you should not have to relive your trauma to be considered a valid survivor or victim. and remember, there is no shame at all in needing space and time away from the internet, the news, this horror circus of women-hating and dismissal of trauma. take space, take time. take care of yourselves ♥️ #repost from @ashlukadraws with @regram.app ... “i am here today, not because i want to be— i am terrified. i am here today because it is my civic duty.” we are all standing with you, dr. christine blasey ford. we believe you. i believe you. you are a national hero.

today is gut-wrenching and heart breaking. if you need to opt out of the news cycle today because it is too triggering— please allow yourself to do so. be gentle with yourself. if you need to talk, i’m here.

#believesurvivors

text: i’m both sickened and inspired by our country this week. i know, i know ... “don’t be political on instagram” they say. but the truth is important and becoming a mother has changed the way i see the world. i’m proud of my responsibility to raise an honest, respectful, courageous, educated woman and will hold other parents  accountable for raising their children the same way. so thankful to mother alongside women who are committed to raising the next generation of americans who respect boundaries, honor bodies, speak up, and show up to elect truly moral (not just privileged) people into power. we can do better. we have to do better.

text:
"a woman must be able to stand in the face of power, because ultimately some part of that power will become hers." - clarissa pinkola estés, women who run with the wolves
.
deep gratitude to all women who have the courage to stand up and speak truth to power. we need all your voices, howls and deep healing on behalf of social and environmental justice. 🐾

send love to those of you feeling triggered by recent events and not ready to come forward. true healing is courageous and powerful in of itself... it creates a shift that we all experience and needs its time 🐾 .
.
.
📷ambassador wolf alawa 🐾
#speaktruthtopower #reclaimthewildwoman #believewomen #believesurvivors #savescotus #thankyoudrblaseyford #thankyouanitahill #ecofeminism #metoo #solidarity #rewild

text:
where are you now
that the ink smeared
itself across the page
blurring black and white
hiding motivations
condemning intentions
dividing all endeavors
for dignity and respect
where are you now
that the exposure
has us frostbitten
naked and scarred
everything given up
bared and sacrificed
once again
once again
once again
and no more
and no more
and no more
hallelujah and amen
if it’s he said she said
then bring it
and then bring it again

#poet #poetryofig #poemsoninstagram #beauty #metoo #rapeculture #strength #womenempowerment #power #voice

text:
for all of the men out there who keep saying, “i would never do that! i’m not that guy!”
y’all need to shut up, too.
we are not going to hand out trophies and accolades for you not assaulting anyone. we are sick of being grateful for your basic human decency as if it were an act of benevolence. if your first thought is “not me” then you’ve got a pathetically fragile ego and/or you must think we are a bunch of hysterical simpletons...which means you’re still a part of the fucking problem.
#stopkavanaugh #metoo

text:
apparently the truth bus 🚌 is parked outside my door. trigger warning, i edited this journal post from some of the more graphic details but please know it could be a trauma trigger for you. i’m going to link some resources in the comments after my post. in order to put this on paper i had to write it as if i was telling fourteen year old me her story. it is her story. it is my story. i was 42 before i ever told anyone my secret. it stayed lodged in me for that long. but now i am free. . #believesurvivors #believewomen #metoo

you were fourteen when it happened in the parking lot of a bowling alley, inside his best friend’s volkswagen rabbit. you shook your head no. he forced his way into you. it hurt so badly but you began to think of other things. noticing the condensation on the inside of the windows formed by his hot breath. you noticed the patterns the little droplets of water made. you noticed the passenger door was unlocked. you wondered what would happen if you reached for the door handle? you heard the sound of rain and wondered if it would drown out the sound of your screaming if you dared scream? you heard the silence of your own breathing. you felt your “no, stop” rising up but it was stuck in your throat. you already knew he hated it when you cried so you swallowed your tears not letting them escape, trapped just like you. it felt like hours were passing by. you imagined yourself far away and safe. it was finally over and he kissed you. you hated the taste of it. you felt like you wanted to vomit and god it hurt. he handed you your pants and told you to get out of the car, he wanted to go bowling. you went inside and walked straight to the bathroom with your head bent in shame. the swirly pattern of the carpet, the smell of popcorn, hot dogs and plastic cheese making your desire to vomit even more intense. the lights are so bright and the music is so loud. you find an empty stall and sit down on the toilet seat even though your mom told you to never do that. what does it matter now? you are stained. you are shit. why, you wonder would it matter if you sat on someone else’s shit? you clean yourself up. (cont. in comments)
name: tacos+rainbows
tweet_full:
apparently the truth bus 🚌 is parked outside my door. trigger warning, i edited this journal post from some of the more graphic details but please know it could be a trauma trigger for you. i’m going to link some resources in the comments after my post. in order to put this on paper i had to write it as if i was telling fourteen year old me her story. it is her story. it is my story. i was 42 before i ever told anyone my secret. it stayed lodged in me for that long. but now i am free. . #believesurvivors #believewomen #metoo

you were fourteen when it happened in the parking lot of a bowling alley, inside his best friend’s volkswagen rabbit. you shook your head no. he forced his way into you. it hurt so badly but you began to think of other things. noticing the condensation on the inside of the windows formed by his hot breath. you noticed the patterns the little droplets of water made. you noticed the passenger door was unlocked. you wondered what would happen if you reached for the door handle? you heard the sound of rain and wondered if it would drown out the sound of your screaming if you dared scream? you heard the silence of your own breathing. you felt your “no, stop” rising up but it was stuck in your throat. you already knew he hated it when you cried so you swallowed your tears not letting them escape, trapped just like you. it felt like hours were passing by. you imagined yourself far away and safe. it was finally over and he kissed you. you hated the taste of it. you felt like you wanted to vomit and god it hurt. he handed you your pants and told you to get out of the car, he wanted to go bowling. you went inside and walked straight to the bathroom with your head bent in shame. the swirly pattern of the carpet, the smell of popcorn, hot dogs and plastic cheese making your desire to vomit even more intense. the lights are so bright and the music is so loud. you find an empty stall and sit down on the toilet seat even though your mom told you to never do that. what does it matter now? you are stained. you are shit. why, you wonder would it matter if you sat on someone else’s shit? you clean yourself up. (cont. in comments)

text:
we need to remember that everyone deserves empathy and respect. all anyone ever wants is to feel heard and empathized with.
✨
by definition, humanity demands to be felt. there is no us and them. there is only we. i dream of a world in which we can have differing opinions and still love one another. difference is what makes us human. it is what makes us whole.
✨
let’s start believing each other and stop shaming. every single person deserves to be seen/heard/loved/believed. let’s lift each other up. it’s the only way to a brighter future.
✨

especially if you live in maine or alaska, but everyone no matter where you live, please call, e-mail, and tweet senators susan collins and lisa murkowski today. ask them to vote no, against the confirmation of brett kavanaugh. thank you!
—
susan collins: (207) 622-8414
(202) 224-2523
@senatorcollins (twitter)
lisa murkowski: (907) 271-3735
(202) 224-6665
@lisamurkowski (twitter)

edited to note: their voicemails are probably full. circumvent the voicemail route by calling the capitol switchboard at 202–224–3121. press zero and ask to be connected to their office individually. 
fax for free here: https://faxzero.com/fax_senate.php.

text:
trying to make sense of things that don't make sense. people are looking for comfort in these trying and very difficult times. some will turn to the religion of their oppressors for solace and hope. i wish i could do the same.  i don't understand how so many christians support abuse against women. then i must remind myself of how the bible is not focused on what would equate to women's rights today.  biblically, they wanted to stone a woman accused of adultery while her co-sinner was not sought after, questioned, nor accused.  previously, it seems people pretended to care about us.  the events of this week, this year, and even the last election cycle...the fact that so many women would elect someone so obviously and reprehensibly against them is telling.  i cannot go to religion, since religion is what brought us to this point.  i'm not sure where to turn.  i cannot lose hope. i just have to figure out where it may be found.

#scotus #womensupportingwomen #womensrights #senatehearing #goodolboys #drford #ibelieveher #nokavanaugh #supremecourt #isupportdrford #metoo #religion #religionandpolitics #religionandwomen #findhope #searchingforhope

text: i am very angry. i am also deeply disappointed that i have learned two key things since november 8, 2016 (which, admittedly, is privileged in itself): (1) despite #metoo america is a dark and misogynistic place that allows too many women to live in fear for our emotional and physical safety, and soon may revoke our right to control our own bodies; and, (2) privileged, cis white men can be so. sickeningly. entitled. #kavanaugh ‘s complete inability to experience any divergence from his personal narrative about himself has affected me personally. this attitude - believing so wholeheartedly in his own, faulty narrative that he is a ‘good’ guy - is the exact same toxic attitude that i was subjected to for years in a partnership that should have been safe, with a man who is a liar. we have got to start addressing the pervasive, toxic masculinity in our society. boys will not be boys; boys will be decent human beings. #enough #standwithwomen #wearewatching #womenvote #stopkavanagh
name: devon🧘🏻‍♀️💚🌍🌮

text:
“grab ‘em by the proserpina”
acrylic, glitter, resin on wood panel, 48”x48”, 2018.
.
last day! open from noon-8p at @andartsf in #sanfrancisco ... hope to see you there.
.
the 2016 presidential election and the partisan divide of the american electorate motors john baunach’s “state of the union.” the frenetic pace and outpouring of seemingly daily controversy of the current administration belies attention to systemic social issues desperately in need of close examination. this body of work attempts to instantiate artifacts that force viewers to consume and inspect concepts related to american diversity, uniformity, and fellowship. proceeds will be donated to local and national support organizations aligned with each pieces’ thematic elements.
.
#art #painting #makethings #contemporaryart #acrylicpainting #gallery #likeawolf #stateoftheunion #metoo #vote

text: i was molested by my best friend. this was over 7 years ago. why have i been silent all this time? is it because i’m lying? or do you think it’s more likely that i was afraid no one would believe me. that people would judge me. people won’t take my side. many of my good friends know what he did and they are still friends with him. one even defended him. do you know how hard that is? that form of betrayal? what do i have to do to make you see the truth?! if my words won’t change your mind then what will? do you really believe all these women are lying???? do you even fucking care? i’m not afraid anymore. i’m angry. #believewomen #believesurvivors #metoo

text: watching kavanaugh give his statement reminded me so much of my own abuser and the face he made while i gave my statement in court.  he had already succeeded in convincing most of my family that i was lying and he was attempting to do the same during the hearing.  he swore he was innocent and cried so convincingly.  had i not been his victim, i may have believed him myself.  abusers are so good at manipulation and playing the victim and our society does a great job at protecting abusers...my uncle was sentenced to 5 years in prison (less with good behavior) but that’ll never be enough time to make up for a childhood filled with trauma and our broken family.  so i can try to say this eloquently but i have zero energy for eloquence and respectability so i’ll just say fuck kavanaugh. we see through your privileged manipulative abuser tears #kavanaugh #stopkavanaugh #believesurvivors #whitemantears #metoo

text:
⁣⁣
all the women.⁣⁣⁣
in me.⁣⁣⁣
are tired.⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
.⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
today i want to be excited that we are two weeks away from celebrating some amazing women in music here in birmingham to raise money for girls rock bham. i’m trying to hold space for the joy and excitement that preparing for this show is bringing me while i’m also so. damn. tired. ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
i don’t know a single woman in my life immune to the ways of wicked men, myself included. they don’t owe you their story or their testimony, but how brave are they to stand up and speak. *don’t worry i’m also grateful for the good guys in my life because i can do both at the same time. ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
here’s to the brave and broken hearted and all of the things you can be at the same time. weary but hopeful. disappointed but pressing forward.⁣⁣⁣
⁣
fight me.⁣

text: impressed by her courage to share in this setting. ••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••christine blasey grew up directly across the street from me. she graduated high school when i was just a little kid so she was already out of the house, but growing up, her parents seemed to be lovely neighbors. ••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••while 15 years apart—-dr. ford and i grew up in such similar circumstances and i used to hang out with kids from all the schools she has been talking about. so much of what she is saying is so familiar and it is surreal to hear it all being talked about on the national stage. •••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••• politics aside, this literally and metaphorically hits so close to home. whatever you believe about this particular case...misogyny should have no place in our culture—no matter what age. #timesup #metoo #enoughisenough #wishthingsweredifferent😔

text:
i have just started the second book 😊 the first one (silence) was so good. it has helped me see that my symptoms are common among so many girls and women who have been through abuse. it goes through so many of the feelings and thoughts but also gives hope that one day you can love your unique self once again. regain the confidence that was stripped away with childhood and recognize the inner strength we all have inside of us. geared more for late teen early 20's, but we're only as old as we feel right? 😂
#bookworm #selfcare #innerpeace #innerstrength #understanding #mystory #metoo #natashapreston

text:
i’ve been struggling the past week, trying to find a way to share these words. it’s never easy, but i think there is strength in vulnerability and watching so many survivors share pieces of their story, makes space for me to feel comfortable doing so with part of mine. •
for years, i wondered if choosing not to report was the right choice. the stigma to “protect the next one, so it doesn’t happen to another girl” is not a fair one. you come first, always. reporting for me, i believe, would cause me so much more harm than help. reporting would not give me peace. i don’t know what quite will just yet, but being in a space that allows us to talk and to listen is a beautiful start. woman, man or non-binary, please believe survivors.
.
.
#ibelieveher #metoo #coloradoartist #instaart #artistsofinstagram #peoplescreative #contemporaryart #artcollective #emergingartist #denverart #showyourwork #modernart #artcollective #abstractexpressionism #acrylicpainting #resinartist #carveouttimeforart #happyartistmovement #abstractobsession #artstudio #lifeofanartist #artfinder #artforthehome #artjournal #creativelifehappylife #studioscenes #artsupplies #makersmovement #calledtobecreative

text_retweet:
#mindfulness 
repost @spiritualgangster ✨
—————————————-
all this feminine #metoo energy has me mindful of my past beliefs about my body.  the experiences i wish i could’ve changed. about uncomfortable situations and unwanted advancements. i’m grateful this deeply repressed universal energy is surfacing and not being silenced. im grateful that women are taking a stand on what is and is not appropriate. hollywood our justice system & men w power and money have beliefs of how they can treat women or people in general. women let’s use this time, as we are, to unite have the hard conversations learn to say no (i know a lot of us already did!!) and create boundaries. sometimes, unfortunately many times, that doesn’t work. 🤦‍♀️ ps guys no means no....
😱
i was kidnapped and groped by an italian cab driver (clearly not a man of money or power) and almost dumped in an abandoned train yard. this was way before cells phones. thankfully my feisty conscience eventually kicked in assessing wtf was happening.  i put the fear of god in him that his appendage would fall off because someone above (☝️)was watching how he was behaving & he would be punished appropriately. he didn’t speak english v well but i gestured everything & he quickly drove me back to my hotel. sad thing is there are many other inappropriate situations like this but usually w wealthy entitled men.  and other situations where men didn’t take advantage.  i learned how to stand my ground but not everyone is always as fortunate (or dare i say ballsy). there’s a lot of abuse that takes place that can crush the human spirit. ✨
it’s important to discuss the things that can happen to our daughters to our friends. women have to support women. this is our time. i feel this female energy 🙏let’s harness it for good things.....
#ibelieveher #timesup 
#mindfulliving  #mindfullife 
#sorrydaddyimok
#ourvoicewillbeheard

text: when women and survivors hearts can’t handle it anymore, when we’ve been so neglected and consistently ignored and disregarded, we cry and scream at senators in elevators. i felt this woman in every bone in my body. i cried and screamed with her. the women who have come forward against kavanaugh deserve to be heard, deserve due process, and deserve due diligence from their government. senator flake heard her and pledged a no vote on the senate floor until the fbi pursues a more thorough investigation. i hope that everyone else chooses to hear her too. #metoomovement #metoo #believesurvivors

text:
perfect

i wish i were stronger. i wish i didn't have to be every woman to be one woman. i wish i was more like my coworkers. i wish they didn't have to work three times as hard as the men in the office and go home to more children. i wish i knew what that felt like. i wish i weren't jealous of their ability to do so. i wish they didn't look me over when i wear a tight dress. i wish i didn't have to think twice about whether or not i'm intimidating someone in the room. i wish i trusted. i wish i hadn't fucked so many people. i wish they didn't smell it on me. i wish i weren't "damaged goods." i wish i were lovable in the ways that make other women lovable. i wish my mom had made me breakfast in the mornings. i wish i knew how to eat breakfast in the morning without throwing up. i wish i wasn't the girl who spent recess running from the boys. i wish i didn't make boys want to lick my wounds once and run away. i wish i were smarter. i wish i were well behaved. i wish i could be a fashionable first lady.  i wish i could be a first. i wish i could be a lady. i wish i knew what made a lady. i wish i were a woman. i wish real women had small breasts.  i wish my worth was not defined by my vagina. i wish my vagina was cleaner. i wish my vagina was messy like the women at work who tell me about bladder incontinence after giving birth. i wish my brain made me a woman and none of the above. i wish you loved me for having none of the above. i wish i loved.  i wish i knew how to feel without every negative emotion coming with it. i wish i were happier. i wish i'm getting better.  i wish someone is listening. i wish someone hurts the same way i do. i wish i'm not alone. i wish i didn't have to take all these pills to trust. i wish my brain worked better. i wish my fight was better than my flight. i wish myself mercy. i wish myself peace. i wish myself better.  gv

#feminist #feminism #woman #metoo #timesup

text: this is the one word i thought would first describe the character of anyone being nominated for scotus. one word. why do we, the citizens, have to keep on reminding these people of what moral principles are? kavanaugh wasn’t on trial yesterday, he was at a job interview. yet he sat up there smug in all his white privilege and litigated. yes, litigated. while dr. ford quietly answered question after question about her own personal assault story. kavanaugh even railed against the left and whined about conspiracies in a completely partisan way and we expect him to sit on the highest court in the land? with all that white male rage and be fair?! step down. help heal a country if you are so concerned about the people of america. in no other job would a position be handed to you while these accusations, 3 of them, were floating about. you know this. the world knows this. and we all know that you lack that one word. integrity. you’re not alone though so i suppose you kept your bro club intact. mcconnell, graham and your other pal who has 14-21 sexual assault accusations of his own which he has been recorded speaking of and has also been proven to pay people for their silence. how do you explain your reasoning for supporting that fraud of a man to your family? you don’t. because you yourself seemingly have no moral principles. no integrity. @nancypelosi #riseup #metoo #timesup #integrity #dontgetcomfortableinofice #openyoureyes #dayofrage #donotsettle #ibelieveher

text:
friends, it has been a rough week. i’m angered by how some of our country’s “leaders” are acting and fearful of the erosion of our judiciary. it’s hard to know what to do, especially since i don’t have voting representation in congress. #taxationwithoutrepresentation .
.
.
i’m grateful for being able to fight back through partnership and friendship with incredible women. it was a joy to have an honest and encouraging lunch with @erin.o.houston of @shopwearwell, one of my favorite people and companies to partner with. fashion is a woman’s industry through and through, from the makers to consumers, and there is much good we can do when we come together. oh, and that necklace i’m wearing is from #wearwell, and everything else you see is #ethical and #sustainable fashion!
.
.
.
#trustwomen #metoo #courage #womanowned #girlpower #mompreneur #sustainableliving #sustainablelifestyle #feminist #womensupportingwomen

text:
i’ve never shared this with anyone, but the vulnerability and stoicism of dr. christine blasey ford’s testimony yesterday compels me to put aside my own shame and share my story of sexual assault. 
in this photo i’m a 19-year-old college freshman. a friend that seemed like a big brother to me came to visit me at school. he picked me up and took me to visit his friend at another nearby college. the evening started out fun. my high school boyfriend and i had broken up recently, and it felt good to get away and think about something else. we were all drinking heavily. i was drunk when the three of us checked into a hotel. i passed out and woke up to the guy i’d just met on top of me. my “friend” was nowhere to be found. he’d left me with this stranger 30 miles from my dorm. in the morning i had to beg the boy who assaulted me to drive me home. he said he would if i’d pay for the gas. 
why didn’t i file charges? because i didn’t even know his last name. because i didn’t want to disappoint my loving parents. because he gave me a ride home. because i was afraid that i’d get in trouble for underage drinking and lose my scholarship. because i was ashamed. because i thought if i was a good person my friend would’ve looked out for me. because i thought if i didn’t tell anyone it would be like it never happened. 24 years later i still remember. but i’m not ashamed of that girl anymore. (more in comments.)

in this photo i’m a 19-year-old college freshman. a friend that seemed like a big brother to me came to visit me at school. he picked me up and took me to visit his friend at another nearby college. the evening staed out fun. my high school boyfriend and i had broken up recently, and it felt good to get away and think about something else. we were all drinking heavily. i was drunk when the three of us checked into a hotel. i passed out and woke up to the guy i’d just met on top of me. my “friend” was nowhere to be found. he’d left me with this stranger 30 miles from my dorm. in the morning i had to beg the boy who assaulted me to drive me home. he said he would if i’d pay for the gas. 
why didn’t i file charges? because i didn’t even know his last name. because i didn’t want to disappoint my loving parents. because he gave me a ride home. because i was afraid that i’d get in trouble for underage drinking and lose my scholarship. because i was ashamed. because i thought if i was a good person my friend would’ve looked out for me. because i thought if i didn’t tell anyone it would be like it never happened. 24 years later i still remember. but i’m not ashamed of that girl anymore. (more in comments.)

text: if you’re feeling the pain of triggered trauma, of being gaslit, of your truth being deemed less valid than someone else’s story, i encourage you to take care of yourself. i’m feeling this sh*t deeply and backslid into some old self-destructive patterns yesterday. today, i am giving myself compassion for those choices and encouraging myself to dig a little deeper into self-care. so, i’m in pajamas under a blanket with my cat and i have a good book by my side. that’s where i am today. it’s ok if that’s where you are too. even if her story is not your story, there is a lot of collective trauma in our souls right now. take care of yourselves.

text:
let me explain in very intimate and very personal words why brett kavanaugh’s hearing matters...
in these photos, i was 17 years old. one, laughing in embarrassment before my senior prom because my mom had to help me with my date’s and my corsages. the other, out being wild with friends on a friday night. 
two weeks after my senior prom, i fell asleep at a friends house after a party and awoke to my panties halfway down my thighs with the boy on top of me begging me to have sex with him. groggy and confused i yelled no, shoved him off of me, and ran upstairs to call the boy i had been dating to come pick me up. 
when he came and picked me up i told him what had happened in a panic. i expected him to be as disgusted and as angry as i was. instead, he called me a liar, rolled his eyes, and dropped me off at my house without another word. 
i kept the story to myself. decided that it wasn’t important and moved on. that was until i got older. i entered college and went to frat parties. i saw girls who were saying no, or clearly too drunk to give consent being dragged into fraternity bedrooms and again i was disgusted. at this point, i had already found my voice. i told boys not to touch me loudly and assertively as soon as they got cocky or aggressive. 
i realize how much damage i may have caused to other women by not speaking out sooner. to this day, that boy still lives in my hometown, used to work with my sister, and still wonders why we’re no longer friends. 
every time i see him, i think of all the other women he may have treated similarly and never felt the ramifications of his actions. 
i have no plans of naming this boy, but because of him i found my voice. 
but you best believe that if he were ever nominated to a position in my government, i would scream his goddamn name to the heavens! 
he would have no place representing any of my fellow women. .
.
my mistake wasn’t having my pants pulled down while asleep. 
my mistake was failing to speak of that boy’s disgusting behavior when it happened.
 if i were given the chance again, i would do it better. 
christine ford had the chance, and she took it! round of applause! 👏🏼#metoo #menext #backtotravelphotosnow

text:
today i wear black in solidarity with mcdonald’s employees protesting workplace harassment. in these difficult times, i am taking solace and strength in the bravery of survivors and the support of allies fighting sexual and workplace harassment and assault. no one should face harassment in their workplace. i believe this, my union believes this, and so does the durham fight for $15 and a union. i cannot be on the picket line with the workers standing up against harassment and abuse but i stand with them in spirit, we will not let you fight alone. 
#metoo #15andaunion #union #believewomen #believesurvivors #standwithsurvivors #dukegradunion

text:
i don't have a lot to say this week... honestly i have avoided the news. i hear pieces and i wish i was strong enough to follow the case right now, but i am not. i am proud and thankful for the strong women around me who are coming forward and yelling and fighting for all of us. a couple weeks ago i started ptsd theripy for numerous things i have encountered in my life. it is a sad fact that when you share things about you, it becomes you... and i am not ready to be labeled. it is a privilege to hear people's experiences, not a right. again, i am so proud to see how people are coming forward for #metoo , but i feel the pressure to open old wounds and tell our stories to justify our outrage and i can't right now... not that i feel this from girls or have anything but love for the movement... but there is such pressure from men, and the general population that we can't be angry about wemon's rights or rape culture unless we tell you the trauma we have experienced... my therapist is working with me on boundaries and telling people to fuck off when they need justification or pry... so with that i say thank you to those who are fighting and i am here for you too those who are still to raw to speak up ❤️ and i say i care, and i cry, and i feel for everyone, while keeping some parts of my life for me right now.
-
-
an old old picture from my home town... because i've been on my computer designing all week and i wanted to say something, but every picture felt weird in context of the caption. love you guys 🙏🏼
-
-
#selflove #selfcare #sheisnotlost #sheisnotbroken #ibelieveher

text:

if you truly love us and are with us then where is your outrage?
✊🏾

where are your conversations with us and one another to foster change?
✊🏾

are you listening? are you paying attention?
men, i really wanna know. are you with us???

text:
hey... everyone who's been "choosing love (*silence)", or who "doesn't get political"...politics is nothing more than how we view the world and the treatment of others. your silence has been complacency for some time now, stop it. speak up. to all the good men out there: that includes you. women need you to be as loud as us, with us. it's not about race or gender,  it's the oldest battle of all: good versus evil. 
#stopkavanaugh #speakup #metoo #ibelieveher #believewomen #stopthem #realmendontrape #notleaders #cowards #wemustunite #smashthepatriarchy #womensrights #righttochoose #women #bearealman #nomeansno #riseup #resist #revolution #enoughisenough #timesup #strongwomen

text: if you can find a woman who hasn’t been sexually assaulted or put in an uncomfortable situation at least once in her lifetime, then i will be shocked. if you can find a woman who has been through the above and has had her claims believed and brought to justice, then my mind will be actually blown. women are stronger than what they’re given credit for. women are braver than what their outside appearances may show. it is time that we lift the stigma against sexual assault and start taking claims seriously so sexual assault survivors do not have to walk in silence, carrying the hurt and trauma everyday. i haven’t endured what most women have, but i have gone through my fair share of having to stand tall when i didn’t want to. #metoo #yearofthewoman #endsexualassault

text:
devil’s triangle is not a drinking game. literally, just fucking google it. 🤬
if you believe dr. ford the only thing left to do is stop him. there are other judges, there is no rush. there are senators on the fence. call right fucking now please. 🔥
sexual misconduct is not a partisan issue, or rather, shouldn’t be. dr. ford has lived for a majority of her life with this attack in her deep psyche. i have lived the last 22 years in virtual silence with my story. you’d shit your pants if i told it, it’s so similar in feeling and essence to what we heard yesterday, except my attacker was sober and alone, and got a little more of what he wanted. 💔
i will do the math for you here and remind you that i was fourteen years old. i hope to never have a reason to speak about the details, and all i hope for my abuser is that he never makes it to a public high office. my #whyididntreport list is a mile long. hell, i refuse to tell my own mother his name to this day because i don’t want it to get out and/or have her rip his dick off. 💯
do you believe me? i have no doubt that some of you would slut shame me if i was in the position dr. ford is in. according to my personal journals some of you who did have knowledge of some version of the incident back then did just that in 1996/97, and really, through the remainder of high school. shit, some of you even shamed me well into our adult years, assuming that because i was willing to have relations with men as a “catholic school girl” i must have just slept with the entire football team. (ftr, i slept with exactly one person during high school. one. i dated him for awhile and it was all consensual) meanwhile, most of you had no idea where my sexual history really “began”-and so this is me forgiving you. but tbh an apology would still be nice...
💪🏽
my father-in-law made an awful joke about my dating history at my engagement party 11 years ago. it was uncomfortable at best. i was so unfazed by that time i rolled my eyes and moved on with my evening, but i think this should all give you an idea of how we treat women versus men, in general. we are sluts and shamed, you are studs and stars. got it.
🧐
(continued in comments)

text:
god has a way of putting you in the right place at the right time & i’ve never felt that as strongly as i did today.
•
shelby has lyme arthritis & needs to be on strong antibiotics for a month.  the pharmacy we normally go to didn’t have any & said they would order them but wouldn’t be available until monday. i said she needs to start today, so they called another pharmacy 20min away. they had some i could pick up to start her now.
•
i reluctantly drove to the other pharmacy.  exhausted & with a splitting headache, i could have just gone to the drive thru, but something stronger wanted me to go inside.
•
while waiting in line, she walks up behind me...this stranger i have never met, but instantly knew her. she was me, 4 years ago.  my heart hurt terribly bc i knew what she was there for as she held on to those $3 with her life.
•
fidgety, skinny & looking like she just rolled out of bed.  caitlin comes up to me as i’m still waiting & said “teenagers are weird” (speaking of the girl behind me bc that’s how young she looked). i just smiled at her while my heart was hurting inside.
•
this girl picked up what she came for & walked away at the same time as me. i followed her & called for her attention. i gave her a hug, said she was beautiful & told her i’ve been there...there is a way out. she didn’t have to live this way anymore. she hugged me tighter & said thank you.
•
i wish i could have done more, but i had nothing to offer her except that hug & a seed of hope to a better life. i hope she lets that seed grow.
•
i instantly started crying as i walked away from her with my girls in tow. they asked why i did that & if i knew her. i said sometimes that all someone needs & then i prayed for her & thanked god for putting there at the exact moment in time...even tho it hurt my heart.
•
#faithhopelove #teamburninitdown #plantingseedsofhope #giveahug #havecompassion #thestruggleisreal #recoveryispossible

text: “i am not mad: this hair i tear is mine; i am not mad: i would to heaven i were! for then, ‘tis like i should forget myself: o, if i could, what grief i should forget! i am not mad; too well i feel the different plague of each calamity. then with a passion would i shake the world; and rouse from sleep that fell anatomy which cannot hear a lady’s feeble voice, which scorns a modern invocation.” #ibelieveher #metoo #notokavanaugh #shakespeare #constance #stopmakingwomenlookhysterical #wearenothysterical #weareunderrepresented #wearenotbeingheard 🎨girouphare

text:
🗽🗽🗽
“don’t look away from me,” she said. “look at me and tell me that it doesn’t matter what happened to me, that you will let people like that go into the highest court of the land and tell everyone what they can do to their bodies.” ms. gallagher declined to be interviewed, but confirmed many details through a spokesman.

ms. archila said that when they confronted mr. flake, it was one of the first times either had publicly shared their accounts of sexual assault. ms. archila, who says she was assaulted when she was 5, said she was moved to tell her story after seeing dr. blasey’s testimony. “when the #metoo movement broke out, i thought about saying it — but i wrote things and deleted it and eventually decided i can’t say, ‘me too,’” ms. archila said. “but when dr. blasey did it, i forced myself to think about it again.”

text_retweet:
#repost @janayaforthefuture with @get_repost
・・・
it has never been about the credibility of women. 
dr. christine blasey ford withstood an impossible degree of scrutiny to prove to the world that kavanaugh, the man seeking a lifetime appointment in the supreme court (highest court in the land), had sexually assaulted her in high school.

dr blasey ford is from the same elite society as brett kavanaugh. to america, her power is only diminished by an unfortunate circumstance of gender. but it wasn’t enough. to be ‘credible’ as a woman is still considered less than an untrustworthy, angry and predatory man. 
dr. blasey ford has been courageous and despite the disgusting response from members of the gop and many from the right, she is hailed as a hero among the political left. 
27 years ago, law professor anita hill also courageously testified during a supreme court confirmation process. she made it clear that judge clarence thomas had sexually harassed her and acted on her civic duty to tell the truth. anita hill was not considered ‘credible’, nor was she embraced by the political left. she was attacked and vilified across the country. were it not for women like anita hill, we would not have movements like #metoo now.

we must shift our need to sacrifice certain women so that others can be empowered. we must continue to fight and learn and grow. 
kavanaugh will be confirmed today, i have no doubt. but i want to remind y’all that this does not mean we lost the fight, on the contrary, the real fight is just getting started. when we fight, we win. 
#anitahill #stopkavanaugh #believesurvivors #christineblaseyford

text: i am terrified to write this but i think it might be time. after many years, i haven't confronted my abuser. i haven't told him that he physically and emotionally abused me or that he sexually assaulted me. i've only told the people in my life who knew him and already thought he was a garbage person. i never told our mutual friends. i never reported it because i didn't know it was assault. i still don't feel it was "serious" enough even though i know it was. even though it left me with lasting emotional scars that i've still only begun to shake off. i'm afraid to hurt his feelings, still. i still care more about how he sees himself. i am afraid to be the reason someone thinks they're a bad person, so i can't tell him that he hurt me. i hope he's seeing what's going on and realizing he did something wrong, but i don't think he is. and posting this is one of the scariest things i've ever done. but seeing dr. ford stand up and stay strong for those of us who can't, and seeing friends and strangers on social media finally sharing their stories, has made me stronger. i may never be strong enough to confront him. but i am strong enough now to say #metoo

text: trauma like deities never works in mysterious ways. however, the ways in which the effects and byproducts of it can be unpredictable. nobody knows if supreme court justice nominee brett kavanaugh absolutely lied yesterday (9/27) about "just being a beer headed bubble child who hung out with friends that never included girls in high school." i mean, it's possible that his story could actually be true but it also comes down to what can be concluded as objectively as possible. i'm not buying his story for the simple fact that a white boy's typical high school experience is not totally separated from pursuit of "getting laid." many a human that has lived on this planet has lost his or her virginity (forced, pressured, or not) in high school. this guy is not totally and/or minorly innocent relative to his past. however, i do give him credit for noting validly how such allegations can and in fact do negatively impact lives and livelihoods. this does not excuse him from having to face the fact that he is a toxic masculinity poster child now. he is a billboard example of it whether or not he is criminally innocent. dr. christine blasey ford did what a lot of white women have done and that is follow in the footsteps of what black women actually began. the "me too movement" was started by a black woman. speaking up about traumatizing experiences in a supreme court nomination hearing setting began with lawyer anita hill against scj clarence thomas. i was a teenager when anita hill came forward and i remember being like my mom where i judged her not him. of course, i was also a christian conservative then and not the atheist-humanist progressive intersectional feminist/womanist that i am today. as a serious critical thinker and political junkie, i do encourage and support halting of the nomination process for completion of fbi investigation into the merits and credibility of dr. ford for substantiation of her claims. i stand with her on the basis of toxic masculinity confrontation needing to continue its rise. i'm grateful for all who come forward and voice their raw truth unapologetically because silence is like comfort. there's no growth in it. 😎✊💯 💭💯

text:
in a city lit by over 3 million people, thick smog forms near-daily from atmospheric pollutants. strikingly, what colors the sky at dusk and fills us with wonder is actually composed by us, our toxins lingering in the air. the sky, like me and you, is cracked, broken by some measure, and that’s how the light gets in. grace by twilight.
.
.
.
when you feel touched by sadness and bitterness too creeps in, find a rooftop, an open field, a dark road leading nowhere and witness a moment of grace. flowers open to seed birds on bindweed. sadness is the bucket we drop to drink from the deep well of our own solitude. sunsets light the dark network of highways moving beneath our skin. these moments matter.

text: to my sons - i promise to you, and to the world, to not raise you under “boys will be boys”. i will not belittle your potential. i will not reduce your humanity. you were each given a spirit of power, of love and of self-control. i will raise you to believe that with every fiber of who you are. i will raise you to know the truth that women have the same spirit. i will raise you to defer to compassion over hatred and slander. i will raise you to error on the side of love rather than error in hate. my boys, you will not be boys. you will be men who are champions for love and respect, for strength and vulnerability. i will raise you to be champion for racial reconciliation. my boys, you will be men who are champions for jesus and his love will be a light in your lives.

text_retweet:
#repost @rachaelmaddox 💛
・・・
hold your beloved. close and with care.
 rest your ear to her heart. listen for its truth in speed and texture, poetry and metaphor.

ask her, how old do you feel, just right here, just right now? ask her, what does that part of you need to know, need to hear? ask her, how can i help you experience repair? – even if i wasn't the one who caused the pain. – even if i accidentally piled more on.

give her space and presence and care, so much care, until something exhales from the center of her pain. (non-poetically, let there be quiet and breathing and no words.
in the absence of your knowing what's going on for her, everything is coming together under her skin.) hold your beloved like the god of redemption is sending light through your willing hands, your steady chest, your loving eyes.

hold your beloved and let her cry and cry and cry

without needing to know why.

if you stay there, dear and willing, she will tell you everything, and you will believe her.

then, in your anger, in your concern, in your fear, you might feel the instinct to ask her if she could've done something differently.

not had those drinks. not smoked that pot. not gone out looking for love or lust or good conversation.

not gotten a job. not gone to the party. not had a god forsaken female body.

tonight, i beg of you – ask a different question:

what's going on with the men? 
you might want to ask, have you ever thought about reporting him?

and mostly, she'll say no. or yes, but... sometimes, she'll tell you how horrible it was.

tonight, i beg of you – ask a different question:

how can i support you? 
hold your beloved. close and with care. rest your ear to her heart. listen for its truth.

this is the first, most important thing you can do.

then tomorrow, put your own two hands on your very own heart and ask the god within, "where should i begin? use me move me make me a force for healing justice protection love." listen. listen. listen.

we needs your hands and your heart, your devotion to doing your part.

i know you want to. i know the king in there is in despair. the real repair is rising.

#metoo #healinghappens #rebloomtogether #love

text:
#whyididntreport
trigger warning

because my rapist was someone i had willingly met at the bar with the intention to have sex. because we got a hotel room and at first i really wanted it. but then he locked me in and did what he wanted with me. i begged him to stop. i fought him. when he finally fell asleep i ran out into denton winter half dressed at 4am. because when i texted my best friend at the time to tell her i needed to go to cvs for plan b, that i'd never bought it and was nervous how to do it, she asked how i could be irresponsible. because when i told her he raped me she said "but you two met with the intention to have sex." i tried to reframe the experience as something i wanted, it makes me sick.

because he was my landlord's son. i rented a room there. i had rejected him and he kept getting more aggressive. going through my things. following me. his step dad told me i shouldn't have led him on. why couldn't i give him a chance? i moved out.

because i've watched my family post memes shaming women who have been assaulted. saying they deserved it. she shouldn't have drank so much. she shouldn't have dressed that way. i've seen them defend rapists and abusers and shame victims. i didn't report because i knew no one would believe me or help me. i didn't report because i was alone in my trauma. i didn't report because the people i trusted had already called me dramatic. i didn't report because i had tried to speak up when grown men had fondled me as a teenager at the grocery store, when strangers touched my hair, and i got weird looks.

#youarenotalone
#thegreyareaofsuicide
#metoo
#ibelieveyou

text:
keep the pressure up, ladies!!! we are affecting capital hill!!!! together, we can take our country forward towards a more free, safe and equitable society that is better for all!! ✊🏻♀️💪🏻 .
•
sisters i’m not sure what we do about the bad men, yet. but it’s past time to call up the good men. 
good men- don’t support us privately. that is no support at all. 
if you believe in our humanity- if you believe our trauma-
if you believe our shared government should protect us all- 
not because we are your daughters or sisters or wives but because we are human beings. 
speak up. use your platforms. they might yell at you. they might laugh at you. they might dismiss you and tell you that you’re crazy. 
when that happens- you’ll know you’ve joined us. but not until then.
call the teachers the husbands the brothers the church leaders the coaches....call the good men up, sisters. good is as good does.
via @glennondoyle
#believewomen #believesurvivors #metoo #timesup #kavanope #republicancowards #slaythepatriarchy
