text:
hey guys did you know she’s from colorado? that’s hip. .
.
recently been diagnosed with a serious bout of the #kavanaugh case blues. good thing dr. ford prescribed me a lifetime’s worth of hope and validation. .
.
it’s incredible to see the conversation about sexual assault and gender being changed by americans, millennials especially. for instance, the other night i was walking home after work at around 11pm on a saturday.

the usual harpo’s harpies were flocking around in clumps on the sidewalk and much to my dismay i had to walk past a group of them to get into my house. it was a group of five boisterous fratty daddies. i braced myself for what was sure to be a slurred catcall and there it was. one of the guys saw me and belted out: “hey!” i looked at him coolly while wondering if my current footwear would allow for a sprint to safety. “hey girl!” he yelled. 
god here it comes i thought. “i hope you have a good night and get home safe!” and then he went back to talking about football with his friends. it was mildly alarming and misplaced but somehow heartening. you too, my man. you too. #queenford #metoo #keepitupyall

text:
story-time: a while ago i was dating a guy who was at least 6‘ tall, heavyset. he didn’t have sisters & i thought it would be helpful for him to hear something. i told him we lived in 2 completely different worlds. in my world, at any given time, a minimum of 50% of the population can physically overpower me. if i leave a store or even work/school at night, i have to walk to my car with a key between my fingers ready to stab an attacker, i have to check my backseat in case someone is laying in wait to hijack me when i‘m in the driver’s seat, i have to wait until the garage door completely closes before getting out of my car so no one can sneak in to attack me in my home. 
you may have the same experience as someone (i.e. walking to your car at night), but that doesn’t mean you experience it the same way. listen to women, hear what they’re saying—you may not understand or see it with your own eyes but that doesn’t mean it’s not real.
________________________________
#margaretatwood #men #women #genderdynamics #fear #safety #menandwomen #gender #assault #listentowomen #toxicmasculinity #feminism #patriarchy #sexism #rapeculture #genderequality #metoo #timesup #shepersisted #girlpower #stopkavanaugh #fuckthepatriarchy #sexualassault #femaleempowerment #christineblaseyford #maleprivilege #believewomen #believesurvivors

text:
historically, women in art have been depicted as compliant and subservient, often looking down or shying away from the perspective of the viewer. in contrast, men are often seen looking straight at the viewer.
.
times have changed. we will no longer be silent and compliant. we are confrontational and unapologetic women.
.
thank you for the inspiration, @bfieldclay

_______________________________________________________

1/3 | the confrontational, unapologetic female gaze | st. lawrence university, 2017 | canton, ny

text: several local students displayed solidarity with survivors of sexual assault thursday (sept. 27) while protesting the confirmation of supreme court nominee brett kavanaugh in downtown taos. taos students were among many who protested across the country thursday in light of kavanaugh's hearing before the senate committee at the white house. “we’re in high school, and we know better,” said taos high school senior leah epstein. “this is a bigger issue than just politics.” the judiciary committee, which includes 11 republicans and 10 democrats, is expected to vote friday afternoon to advance kavanaugh’s nomination. republican leaders have vowed confirmation of trump’s nominee by early next week. 📸 by @morgan_timms

text:
***trigger warning*** i share this for multiple reasons: to get me further along on the road to closure, to let others know they are not alone, and to help others understand this happens much more often than they realize.  this little girl did not deserve to be molested by someone in her life that should have been a role model and safe place, but she was. and she has had to live with that shame, swept clumsily under the rug, for all her life. 🖤 
i’m finally at the point in my journey where i am trying to put this behind me, no longer wanting to be held down by the past, wanting to be free of the shame, which i never should have felt in the first place.  it feels good to be working towards that.
our society as a whole can feel really fucked sometimes (more often than not right now), but please, in these trying times, look for the good in your life, it can help ease the pain and discomfort, and just know you are very much loved.  if anyone wants to talk, i am here to listen.  you are loved and worthy of all that is good. 🌹 
#metoo #childhood #trauma #ptsd #riseup #selflove #selfcare #youareworthy #mentalhealth #livingwithpain #roadtorecovery
name: JESSiCA sawyer.

text_retweet:
#repost @mother_indica ・・・
women being sexually assaulted and abused is both ancient and very well present. most of these stories of violence go untold. most unheard. these experiences swell within us and rip us at our very core, fundamentally changing the people we are today.
.
i act as this is not our future. i imagine a society where women are both empowered and untouched. a society in which a woman can speak her mind, her truth, and her expression of self, all while not being shrugged off, disregarded, or attacked.
.
a society where a boy knows that no means no, and that anything beyond is unwarranted and a violation to her dignity. that the ego and ideology of a man does not ultimately dictate the details of a stranger’s life, like the fate of her womb, her comfort and innocence, her hormone regulation, or the ptsd she is now forced to bare.
.
i yearn for a world where a woman’s voice is just as potent as the cries of a man. where she doesn’t have to bite her tongue and remain silent in fear of repercussion.
.
our scars are deep, but they are interwoven amongst our sisters. they are what ultimately bind us. and as women are beginning to wake up and practice expressing our voice, our hurt, movement happens. change begins.
.
daily, i am working towards this future that i see. i am teaching my son how to be an equal. teaching him the importance of boundaries and how to defend his own and respect others’. what it means to explore and express his emotions, that he needn’t keep them hidden.
.
to function as a healthy, free society we must change what we tolerate. we must stand up for ourselves and speak our truths, and listen to the truths of others. this is possible. i believe in all of us. and it starts with speaking up. you are not alone. #metoo #believesurvivors #speakyourtruth
.
art @bykellymalka

text:
"late thursday evening, the aba called for an fbi investigation into sexual assault allegations against kavanaugh before the senate judiciary committee votes on his supreme court nomination ... "one interviewee remained concerned about the nominee’s ability to be balanced and fair should he assume a federal judgeship,” the aba committee chairman wrote to senators in 2006. “another interviewee echoed essentially the same thoughts: ‘(he is) immovable and very stubborn and frustrating to deal with on some issues.’” a particular judge had told the aba that kavanaugh had been “sanctimonious” during an oral argument in court. several lawyers considered him inexperienced, and one said he “dissembled” in the courtroom.

delay the vote!!! #trumpchicken 🐥

text:
time magazine reported that the national sexual assault hotline saw a 147% increase in calls during the christine blasey ford hearing.

survivors: we are here for you. we see you. we hear you. you are not alone. what happened is not your fault. you have allies in this fight. 
please call our hotline if you or someone you know is in need of assistance. our counselors are ready to listen- 24/7, 365 days a year.

text:
🌼are you miserable enough to make a change yet?
.
.
🌿have you suffered enough yet?
🌿have your friends and family suffered enough yet?
🌿have you given enough of your life to your abuser yet?
.
.
✨sounds strange and ridiculous but people hate change so much that they are willing to live their whole life being absolutely miserable. .
✨they bury all their skeletons in their neat little basement and they act like they aren't living above a giant graveyard. i've seen it dozens of times.
.
.
🌿let me tell you this. just because you suppress your past, avoid dealing with it, and act like everything is fine does not mean shit. you may have convinced other people that you are "happy" but that's not the truth❤
.
you are trapped in a prison from the past. the longer you try to run from it the harder it's going to be. it's not going away.
.
.
🌿so again i ask you.. are you miserable enough to face it yet? .
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

text:
i stand with and believe dr. christine blasey ford. 
when are we going to start believing that survivors of sexual assault are speaking the truth? 
dr. blasey ford has nothing to gain from coming forward about her attacker, laying herself bare in front of a panel of senators, a sex crime prosecutor, and the country as a whole. 
this hearing rips open an old wound of being persecuted myself for coming forward about being raped at @arizonastateuniversity . being interrogated by the dean of students and many others is one of the most traumatic things that has happened in my life, more so than the assault. 
i can only offer my thoughts, support, and prayers to dr. blasey ford. i can only imagine how traumatizing and distressing this hearing has been. know the survivors stand with you. you are an inspiration to us all. 
when will it be time to believe women? #metoo

#christineblaseyford #believesurvivors #believeblaseyford #survivor #standwithsurvivors #timesup #longpost #longpostalert #triggerwarning #sexualassult #stopkavanaugh #metoomovement #metoo

text:
having grown up in venezuela and having witnessed first hand how a once thriving democracy was destroyed by an authoritarian regime, i refuse to remain silent with what is going on here. .
.
.
ask yourself who has more motivation for lying? is it the doctor who’s life got ruined to no benefit of her own, or is it the judge who is about to be appointed for life as a supreme court justice ($250k year plus benefits and status). just allow the fbi to investigate if there is nothing to hide. .
.
.
.

text: this one is long and personal and brings up a lot but it’s also important to share. i haven’t gone into much detail publicly about my #metoo moments. there is a story from my childhood that is too painful to open up about but has changed my life significantly. when hearing this christine blasey ford story it brings me right back to a different moment when i was 20 years old. it was halloween at a party and a man about 30 years old closed me in a room, pushed me on the bed and held my arms down. i was confused, i couldn’t move, he was much stronger than me. i remember screaming no!!! so loudly. he didn’t care at all. he liked the struggle. i felt so furious and full of adrenaline. i remember kicking my knee between his legs as hard as i could and running out of the room with him bent over in pain. that could have ended very differently. when i hear christine’s story it brings back all that rage. and i know it does for so many other women too. it makes me want to scream i believe her. and i do. she’s helping women everywhere and i just want to publicly thank her for that. 💛
name: bri emery / designlovefest

text: with all this "boys will be boys" talk i just wanted to show pages from bill cosby's book childhood where he & his friends attempt to buy an "aphrodisiac" to slip into girls' drinks so that they would go crazy & take their clothes off for them. roofie-ing & attempting to use date rape drugs recounted as a silly boyhood activity from a convicted sex offender.  #believesurvivors #believewomen #stopkavanaugh #noonkavanaugh #billcosby #ibelieveher #metoo #drchristineblaseyford #timesup @timesupnow @natalieportman @ilanusglazer @refinery29 @huffpostwomen @huffpost @ronanfarrow

text: i am tired. i am tired of feeling powerless. i am tired of feeling like my decisions are being stripped from me. i am tired of feeling like my voice isn’t being heard. i am tired of feeling like my government is no longer working for me. i’m just tired. but that doesn’t mean i stop fighting, because this is what they’re counting on. i’m positive this quote was about personal growth and all that nice stuff, but honestly, i read it this morning and felt like it was a call to all of us to stand up and fight back even harder.  they thought women were angry before?  they thought #metoo and #timesup were just a couple of nice little hashtag online movements?  ladies, let’s show them otherwise. get out and vote.  if you can, financially support the candidates that support you. engage your legislators. challenge them. make them listen. they work for you. we are a tsunami. gentlemen of the judiciary committee...you have only angered the beast. yeah, i’m tired, but that doesn’t mean i’m giving up. no way. you want to take me out?  it’s gonna be kicking and screaming.

text_retweet:
#repost @mattmcgorry with @get_repost
・・・
brett kavanaugh is the symptom. rape culture and patriarchy is the disease. same with trump. same with the rapists outted by the #metoo movement (not to mention white supremacy, capitalism, etc). men, if you actually care...listen to women, and the women on the front lines of the anti-sexist, anti-rape culture, feminist movement and get to work. and if you’re a man, wondering if i’m talking about you, i can assure you that i am. you need to be a man that other men know stands against rape culture. that other men know won’t let this shit slide. that other men can come to you with their questions about what to do to be a part of the solution. we all have circles of influence, and we need to influence them. we don’t deserve credit for not being a kavanaugh, a trump, or a weinstein. the only way to change this world to make it safer for women and girls is to be preemptive and do the shit that you see almost no other men doing. when you see lots of women in your life re-posting an article or a meme about rape culture, but not men doing it, you do it. violence against women is *men’s* violence against women over 99% of the time. this is our job to fix. guys, next time you hear liberal men complaining about kavanaugh, ask “what are you doing to end rape culture?”

text:
the next 6 months are going to be super busy. this is the maquette of a sculpture i was asked to design last year for justice for lai dai han. i am thrilled and honoured to have been given the go ahead to create a life size bronze of this sculpture for this interesting and important international campaign. the “lai dai han” are the tens of thousands of children of vietnamese women raped by south korean soldiers during the vietnam war. many of the girls were as young as 12 or 13 at the time, and more than 800 victims are still alive. today, as a result of the assaults that took place, tens of thousands of young adults of mixed vietnamese-korean heritage live in the shadows of vietnamese society, living in poverty and without access to social services, such as healthcare and education.  between 1964 and 1973, some 320,000 south korean soldiers were deployed to vietnam to fight alongside the united states.
the government of south korea has never recognised the sexual violence that took place and has never apologised for the crimes of its soldiers. these brave women have waived their anonymity to end the generational abuse and stigma that is handed down to their children. this sculpture aims to raise awareness to their plight and that of millions of others whose lives are blighted ( even today) by those who use rape and sexual violence as a weapon of war.

#stoprapeasweaponofwar #rapeasaweaponofwar #vietnam #women #girls #metoo #laidaihan #justiceforlaidaihan #vietnamwar #comfortwomen #womensrights #southkorea #artasaweapon #artasactivism #womeninart #artwithamessage #bronze #bronzesculpture #sculpturegallery #figurativeaculpture #publicsculpture #artoftoday #sculptor #figurativeclaymodelling #wiltshireartist #hampshireartist #lifesizebronze #rebeccahawkinssculpture #endingsexualviolenceinconflict

text:
is it just me or is this week triggering af? i have personally been reliving every trauma of my life this week-and i have always considered myself a “lucky” woman because my trauma mostly came from previous partners and not strangers in the bushes. but one story has been swirling in my mind all week. one that i haven’t thought about in years. .
.
when i was in my early twenties i partied hard one night at a good friends house. so hard that i ended up passed out in a recliner in their living room. am i proud of this? not particularly. when it was time for everyone else to go to bed, a stranger clearly made me their target. my friend at the time noticed this guy zero in on me and saved me. instead of ignoring the warning signs, my male friend climbed into the recliner with me and told this stranger to get the fuck away from me. he spent the night in that recliner with me. if he hadn’t, there is no doubt in my mind this stranger would have raped me. in my friends house. a place i thought was safe. .
.
i am telling this story because i want to acknowledge that trauma comes in different forms and we have been damaged. damaged  by the actions of men who don’t know us and men that do. do i think this guy remembers me or what he was trying to do? absolutely not. but his actions are still with me 10 years later and probably will be 30 years later. this has to end. to all my friends, i see you. i believe you. also, sorry mom and dad. i’m sure you don’t want to read about this on instagram #ibelieveher #metoo #timesup #thefutureisfemale #imdonebeingnice #imdonebeingquiet

text:
her value is not less than his. 
kavanaugh likely did this to many more women. he didn’t focus on it (and maybe doesn’t even remember it) because it meant nothing to him—it was entrenched in his prep school boyhood culture, despite the adverse impact on the girls (now women) he harmed. they weren’t part of his narrative, they didn’t count, and he doesn’t think they do now either. and neither does the gop.
.
.
.
.
.
.

text_retweet:
save the date!!!!!
*
*
#repost @aapiwomenlead with @get_repost
・・・
speaker announcement! we are thrilled to share that surina khan, the ceo of the women's foundation of california, will be our morning keynote.
.
surina khan is ceo of the women’s foundation of california where she leads the foundation’s work to advance the health, safety, and economic security of women, girls and transgender people in california. the foundation’s program strategy is focused on building community-based power through investing in community organizations, training community leaders in policy advocacy, convening key partners, and mobilizing significant financial resources. for more than two decades, surina has been a leader in the philanthropic and non-profit social justice sector starting with local community-based publishing in new england and then shifting to national and global work on an array of social justice issues including women’s rights, lgbt rights, human rights and more. she is a recognized advocate for gender, racial, and economic justice and a frequent commentator on the power of women’s philanthropy.
.
.
learn more about @womensfoundationca .
registration link in bio!
.

text:
to all my siblings who are feeling a certain kind of way due to the coverage of the ford/kavanaugh hearings, let me say this: 
you feel those #feelings, and you pay attention to those #tears. i am listening and you are not alone. 
i support you in your silence, and in your speaking up. only you can decide when it is safe to come forward. *if* it is safe to come forward. 
i grieve for your injury and for the ways that moment (or moments) affect your lives and your living. 
i weep for any shame you bear that was handed to you or that you have placed upon yourself. you deserved better. you *deserve* better. 
i am holding you all - the known and the unknown - in this moment now and going forward. 
because we are in this #together. 
because you are loved, and you are beloved, and you are still perfectly fashioned and beautifully made. 
because, #metoo.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
#rethinkchurch #umc #gcsrow #cosrow #believethem #donoharm #clergywomen
name: Alicia Vélez Stewart

text:
i'm feeling all the feels these last few days but mostly triggered af. it feels like the stories don't matter. it feels like we don't matter. then, when one of us braves telling our story in front of millions of people, it's not enough.
_
politics aside, even if we don't matter to those in power and nothing has changed, i know.... i can feel that we matter to anyone with a moral compass, a shred of decency. i think generations from now, the #metoo and #timesup movement will be a turning point but of course we're not there yet.
_
and until we're there, remind yourself that you matter. for me, it helps to get on my yoga mat. but whatever you need to do, do it because you matter. you deserve to be here. you have a voice that deserves to be heard now and far after november. 
_
#allthefeels #madashell #youareenough #yogapractice #alltheyoga #ibelieveher

text:
#whyididntreport 
because i was 19 and didn’t understand that i was raped. because i was extremely drunk and underage so i thought i would get in trouble. because i also took pills that night so i thought it was my fault. because i said yes when he invited me back to his friends’ place. because i wanted to hangout with him that night. because after it happened i sank into a depression and began abusing alcohol and pills and became very promiscuous. so this must just be “me” now, i thought. i must have wanted it. i’m shaking as i type this. so i cannot imagine being up on stand. i salute all the brave women going through this difficult time. i see you, i believe you, i am you.
.
.
whether you choose or are able to tell your story doesn’t make it more or less valid. my intention in sharing my story is to spread understanding and provide hope and voice to others ❤️. if anyone you love or know is struggling please listen to them with understanding. ask them if they are okay, and most importantly, believe them because most of us can barely believe themselves and this is the number one thing that prevents healing. #believesurvivors
name: Amanda E. White, LPC, E-RYT

text:
this is how old i was when i was first sexually molested. notice in all three images i’m wearing the same patriotic outfit i loved so much it disintegrated through constant use. i’m not feeling as though my country loves me back today. 🌟

believe what you like, but girls are programmed to stay silent. we shouldn't cause waves, we should be polite, we shouldn't ruffle feathers or engage in "ugly" behavior. we should fold our hands in our laps, cross our legs at the ankles, and our voices should never be louder than the loudest man in the room or, god forbid, we'll be labeled "shrill". 🌟

which is why i didn't tell my parents why i was late for dinner at the age of six (because the teen-aged girl who lived next door lured me into her house with candy and molested me), and instead chose to remain quiet as i was sent to my bedroom hungry. that would teach me to not mind the clock. 🌟

which is why at the age of fourteen i never told my parents why i didn't speak for a week after having a sleep-over at a friend's house, waking up in the middle of the night to her father on top of me, grinding away over my clothes, telling me how he couldn't help it, because i made him crazy... and his wife didn't understand him. 🌟

the worst stories, actual rape by “boys being boys,” took place after that, but i'll spare you those. forgive a lot of women today who are feeling edgy around all the bullshit we've swallowed quietly for a few damn decades. i'm sorry if this makes you uncomfortable but i work with a lot of women who live with discomfort on a near-constant basis due to "staying quiet" throughout their lifetime. 🌟

#wetoo #divinefeminine #metoo #metoomovement #metoo❤️ thank you @glennondoyle & @abbywambach for being my #northstar right now. #speakup #saysomething #nomoresilence #timesup

text: it’s been a super rough couple of weeks, emotionally, for many reasons. #seasonalaffectivedisorder #seasonaldepression #heartache #washington #metoo #triggered #toomanyfeelings today is the first day in forever that i have felt like me, and i’m headed to the @therubysf to go write, work, and be amongst a community of bad ass women. what did i do to feel better? meds. stay hydrated. journaled. the hard part, which was crucial!!!!- was reaching out to some people i felt safe letting know i was in a super bad place, and why. i’m not a failure. i’m not broken. i’m just here and trying- like everyone else on this planet.

text: when you share your most intimate secret that you have kept for the past 26 yrs and you have the strength to share that with people that don’t know you, strangers, friends and family members on social media who never knew this just to show people that no matter that picture you hit like, or comment there’s always something more deep in that person’s life.! 😕 they say you don’t know your true friends when you are in the dark and this can’t be any truer. this social media platform is not only to post cute pictures of selfies, food, blogging events, makeup, freebies, vacations, memes or whatever your heart desires. it’s also to have a voice for those who are scared to come forward. for our kid’s sake, for victims of sexual assault women and men. for our immigrant children’s, those who are left without hope and love or anyone who’s scared and lonely for whatever reason going through dark times. so today i shared that i was sexually molested when i was young. 11 years old. i don’t remember the exact day of the week, time and even the month, however i do know this happened just like i know today i’m married and i have a beautiful family and because of that i come forward to share my story and to stand by every single women and men that feel like today our government and society failed us. remember you have kids of your own, or you might have them in the future. think about the example you leaving behind. you can call me another stupid snowflake democrat, or liberal but you are welcome to unfollow me. that says more about your character than mine. at least i can go to sleep with my conscience knowing that i’m doing everything in my power to do what’s right not only for my boys but those who don’t have a voice. #ibelieveher #stopkavanaugh #myvoice #mytruth

text:
we are all capable of violence... just because you know a person & have never witnessed them to be violent...doesn’t mean they aren’t capable of being so.
the weather can be sunny on one side of a county & rainy on the other. 
humans are deep emotionally complex beings; there is no way to fully know what a person is capable of... the kindest person you know... might be a violent abuser in the isolation of their own home. you don’t know... unless you are a victim of said abuse.
believe victims...
believe womxn. 
believe their pain both physical & emotional...
patriarchy protects abusers, feminism advocates for victims & survivors of abuse...
which side are you on...?
if you side with an abuser... you are upholding the patriarchy...and no one wins under patriarchy
#heysgay #womenwhodraw #believewomen #smashthepatriarchy #believesurvivors #metoo #metoomovement #womensrights #women #womxn .

text:
today is the first day being completely sober since march 2016 when i relapsed after a 2.5yr sobriety journey...🙈🙈🙈 i'm not gonna lie, i've struggled with addiction my whole life and have battled anxiety, depression, substance abuse and eating disorders since i was 12 years old.

my life seemed pointless and valueless especially when others tried to bring me down. everything in life was a trigger to my trauma. i didn't have the best childhood memories and i tried my best to bury them deep beneath my substance use and abuse. 
it didn't work... and doesn't work! i only forgot parts of yesterday and missed being present in each day.

i'm done with those who don't motivate or encourage me to strive for greatness. isn't it everyone's dream to be a better version of themselves? well it is for me and i'm done drowning in my fear to move on... #forgivenessfreesyou #forgiveness #forgive #lessons #lifeishard #lifeisgood #freedom #trauma #childhoodtrauma #sexualabuse #surviving #onedayatatime #loveyourself #metoo

text: i thought about sharing this for a split second and then wrote it. i dropped out of my sorority, campus police had a picture of him, i was also verbally harassed by my sorority sisters for not showing up to events. he did show up on campus more than once and they were quick to kick him out. i moved to a different state so i didn’t feel like i needed to look over my shoulder. time heals (for the most part). ask if you want. i’m ok talking about it now. on a side note, my dad is always one to voice his opinion and i’ve never seen him be so quiet. #metoo

text: what is the lie? the lie is that i have to pretend to be a strong black woman all the time. i love being black. i love being strong. but i am also a woman. i love. i hurt. i cry. i carry burdens. sometimes the woman wrapped in this body doesn't want to be strong. it's okay to be a boss that feels and expresses emotion.  we often get shamed for being passionate, expressive or tired. just because a woman is strong doesn't mean that she can't benefit from a soft touch, a warm heart and few days off. it's essential to replenish without apology..#feminist #feminism #love #artist #girlpower #equality #women #art #woman #womenempowerment #girls #selflove #thedeathofalie #blackwomen #empowerment #activist #metoo #beautiful #fashion #mentalhealth #bhfyp #essencemagazine #femalepoets #blackgirlswrite #womenempowerment

text: mood...there are many who view women as frightening, mad, disgusting. #sheelanagig confirms for me that there are women now and across the centuries with awareness that their bodies are sacred. we will continue to meet at the collective holy well of sheela, hands joined to say -we will not forget! some #sheelanagigs have been removed from irish, scottish, british & other european churches, but many remain, symbolically thumbing their noses at those who would have them destroyed or vandalized and saying always and forevermore - we are a divine reflection of mother earth and despite your efforts we will not be defaced!we are here to stay! #justyouwait#silenagig #sheilanagig #metoo

text: i created this piece after a man who i did not know made threatening remarks and put his hands on me in a public place. i usually have no issue telling strange men to back off but this man was wearing a uniform. i stand at 6'2" and walk proudly. i usually feel strong. that day, i felt powerless. i felt small. i felt that if i tried to report what had happened, no one would believe me because this man held a position of power. so to work through what had happened, i did what comes naturally to me...i made a piece of art with as much visual venom as i could muster.  like so many women, i'm so tired of always having to be on guard.  our bodies are not fair game. we're going to start biting back.

text:
this post is dedicated to @padmalakshmi and #drford. she is part of my history when you’ll be asked “where were you?” i couldn’t help but relive the traumatic memory of dr. ford with her. 
i believe her. 
i will always believe her. 
i will believe you too. 
without judgement. 
criticism. 
cynicism. 
always. 
this is not an era that people need to be careful about. this is not going to pass and be replaced with something new. we don’t need protectors. we don’t need laws for if/then situations. #padmalakshmi #womensrights #thisisnotanera #metoo #sharks #weareallsafe

text:
for some this might be a bit much, but for others it’s a reality... kids, girls, boys and women are raped, molested , sexually assaulted every day. some it’s hidden so well you wouldn’t even know, others out in school settings or society because they are being harmed. there was a case in north georgia of a upstanding family man. wife and kids a father of a young girl.. who molested another child often. no one even thought this man would do it, how could he they asked... he is a father, a business man. “he doesn’t look like an abuser” well who does??? what does a sexual predator look like? how many trafficked victims have been bought by white collar, blue collar workers? how many women who seem like normally everyday ladies buy and sell young girls and boys... i say all this to say it happens and most victims don’t want to tell anyone for fear, shame etc.. this girl in this phot dressed up would never say hey mom dad or mr/mrs so and so touches me... sometimes it takes years to brave it... i know because it took me years to accept what happened to me and share it with someone... sexual violence against women, men and kids has to stop. and those who do these acts need to get help... it can be anyone ..... .
.
.
.
#stop

text:
right now, milllions of women are experiencing being on trial and their rapist/abuser being given the benefit of the doubt while she, herself, was energetically violated by being put on public display and he cried for being asked to take ownership of his actions. and, there are stories being told for the first time are coming out all over social media because women cannot hold it in any longer.
.
there is a lot of trauma and pain surfacing right now.

a lot.

our bodies do not feel safe.
.
the adrenaline of trauma triggers can have us reaching for more of the same to stay connected, know we aren’t alone, to get out all the bad feelings and, ultimately, unconsciously with the hopes of resolving itself.
.
trauma is always seeking to resolve itself.
.
as we watch this play out on the big stage, this is very important to remember. we are all seeking to complete this unconscious trauma loop of rape and abuse, shaming victims who do not feel safe to seek safety or justice while the perpetrators go free because, well...they can.
.
we need a different outcome.
.
it is a collective trauma. and, it is very personal. women must deal with this on a daily basis.
.
yesterday, i went to the grocery store and a man approached me quite assertively, reached out to shake my hand. when he took it, he squeezed my hand so hard it hurt while seemingly “flirting” with me and asking me how long it was going to take me to be done with my shopping. i pulled my hand away, stepped away slowly, assessing his energy and staying in my own. instead of telling him i wasn’t interested, i told him i wasn’t available. because, it is safer for a woman to seem like she has a man in her field, even when she doesn’t, than to say she isn’t interested. he left after trying to grab my hand again. i felt okay, a woman nearby asked me if i was okay. i said i was. then, as i was checking out, i started panicking. i realized he could be outside. he could be outside. my body went into panic mode. i stood inside the store and called for a lyft and ran out to the car when it arrived and nearly burst into tears..
(more below...👇)

text:
why don't women come forward about sexual assault?

another reason

we saw the response to the kesha ruling. we saw what happened to anita hill. and the list goes on.... we know how we are going to be treated when we speak up....especially speaking out against a man with a "good reputation." after being assaulted, why put ourselves through the trauma of public ridicule?

#ibelievesurvivors #breakthesilence #whyididntreport #metoo

text:
i can't comprehend what's happening. this is why women and men don't come forward when they are sexually assaulted. because people don't believe them. they believe that their stories are lies and are just made up because they want to ruin someone's life. •
this is why so many survivors never share their stories. they don't want to relive it and be told it was all a lie. to blame someone's else's actions on their own. that we shouldn't have drank so much. that we should of covered up. that we shouldn't have gone anywhere alone. that we are the reason for being assaulted. that it's our fault that he felt like he had the right to touch us and make advancements in us. •
i didn't report because i was extremely intoxicated. i didn't report because he was well liked in our school. i didn't report because i was just taken to a train station and shoved out of the vehicle when my parents showed up, by my classmates. i didn't report because i felt like it was my fault. 
#whyididntreport •
#timesup #metoo #standup #nomore #survivor #strongwomen #independentwoman #powerful #takeastand #stoptrump

text: #ibelieveher because i, and so many women before and after me, have lived through this horror. day in and day out, victims and survivors carry this burden and this heartbreak. all because the man that did this to me is “loved,” “trusted,” and whatever the fuck else people think about him. my burden is a big, ugly, intimidating, privileged white male. his mommy and daddy and now apparently even his sister protect him and guide him through his perfect little life while i am reminded every single fucking day what happened to me. how i was taken advantage of by someone i trusted. the monday before thanksgiving nonetheless. imagine sitting with your family and trying to be joyful when you were raped not but 72 hours before. just try to imagine that. while he spent thanksgiving with his family, giving not a single fuck about his actions. in his mind, it was probably nothing. in his mind, it was easy because i was drunk and asleep. in his mind, it was okay because he’s a police officer. police officers are supposed to protect us, right? technically yes. literally though, no. my trust is broken forever. and every day i’m reminded that my trauma, my truth, my rights, are not as important. because i’m a small, feeble brained woman. i stand with #drblaseyford because #sexualassault and #rape are running rampant. i want my fucking safety back. i want myself and all the women that surround me- black, white, asian, anything. it doesn’t matter. we are women and we deserve to be treated as such. i’m not just someone’s sister, daughter, cousin. i’m a fucking person. and my vagina and my truth are not up to anyone’s discretion except my own. #thankyoudrblaseyford for risking your entire life to tell us the truth to #stopkavanaugh 🙌 we need to #vote in november. you and all your friends. if you choose not to vote, let me know, so i can write you out of my life, because i deserve better than someone like you. #metoo #timesup @timesupnow @metoomvmt #thankyou

we believe you. 
we support you. 
we love you.

text:
why don't women come forward about sexual assault?

if you're asking the question, then you've likely never been assaulted.  it's hard to fathom if you've never experienced the very real shame and shaming that goes with sexual abuse in particular. this is why rape is systematically used in times of war to break an entire culture...so i'm gonna periodically post reasons why from my perspective, as i'm among those that didn't report it. 
reason

i didn't (and still don't) want to be thought of as "damaged," told that i'm disclosing too much (because it makes other people uncomfortable), rejected by men and women as if sexual assault is contagious.  plain and simple, i didn't and still don't want sexual assault to be what people think about when they think of me.

and i'll add that i'm totally out of the closet as a survivor, i'm 42 years old, i've done my trauma work on the topic, and it's still hard to write these posts because i'm so afraid of judgement.  we are taught to keep quiet as survivors. we must learn to break the silence if we want things different for our daughters and granddaughters.

#ibelievesurvivors #breakthesilence

text:
why don't women come forward about sexual assault?

another reason

in a couple of cases, i knew those that assaulted me. for some unknown reason that continues to this day, i feel the need to protect their reputations by not saying anything bad about them. 
if you're a survivor, perhaps you'll join me in sharing reasons why...together we can break the silence and support those that are having to speak publicly about one of the worst moments of their lives. #ibelievesurvivors #breakthesilence

text:
why don't women come forward about sexual assault?

another reason

the brutal physical exam, including photographs of genitalia, only to have rape kits just sit untested.

if you're a survivor, perhaps you'll join me in sharing reasons why...together we can break the silence and support those that are having to speak publicly about one of the worst moments of their lives.

#ibelievesurvivors #breakthesilence

text_retweet:
we are so proud of you mariana! 💗 #repost ・・・
1 out of every 6 women have been a victim of sexual assault or violence. there are many still living in silence and in fear. 
i was a victim of domestic violence, i did doubt myself, i thought i couldn’t get out, but i did! i overcame that fear and i am no longer silent! i’m here to let you know that i survived!! i’m happy, i’m healthy and i’m moving forward with my life. i want you to know that you are beautiful, you are strong, you are worth it and your happiness matters! if you think you can’t do it, please reach out and ask someone for help! 💕
i’m so blessed to be a part of rock paper scissors foundation!❤️ @rockpaperscissorsfoundation @denise_barkleyboyd @breakthesilence_conf 
rock - no matter what you throw at me.
paper - no matter how you try to crumble me.
scissors - no matter how you try to cut me down.
i will overcome!!!❤️

text: i was blessed to present at the 25th silver celebration sister to sister conference. god blessed me to give & receive healing. the death of a lie is giving  me life. my presentation was pausation: the act of pausing. there are things in our lives that will always make us pause. it's what we do in a pause that determines how long we stay there. pray and press though. you're worth it. i'm worth it. what is the lie? the lie is that you don't have time to learn to love you. if you don't learn you'll never be able to recognize it in others.#feminist #feminism #love #artist #girlpower #equality #women #art #woman #womenempowerment #girls #selflove #thedeathofalie #blacklivesmatter #meme #empowerment #activist #metoo #beautiful #fashion #mentalhealth #bhfyp #essencemagazine #femalepoets #blackgirlswrite #blackgirlsrocks #bosschick

text:
.
then and now. ladies, i stand with you today and every day. it becomes clearer and clearer why + how sacred sisterhood will save the world or at least ‘merica.
.
as we can plainly see + what has been made breathtakingly clear is no one is coming. no one is coming to save us (despite that patriarchal voodoo involving a white dress and walks down aisles). power is not given, it is taken in patriarchy. you must be prepare to fight for what is right + for what is your’s.
.
we have been conditioned to put the needs + well-being of others before ourselves and to claim it a virtue. it is not. this is what that brainwashing it results in. unequal pay + an unprocecuted rape every 98 seconds.
.
we have as women ourselves + each other. that is all. decide you are going to stand with + for yourself and other women, in all ways and in all things. if you have not discovered the joy and integrity of true sisterhood + solidarity (not sisterhood based on mutual financial gain, ahem, oil sellers and so forth😁), with complete strangers, for no reason other than itself, you are missing out.
.
it’s a different kind of power than the one we get playing the game of patriarchy where our mutual success is not assured and indeed, having most fail and only few succeed is a particular and perverse pride. #ibelieveyou #pubichaircokecan #sexualassault
.
.
.
.
.

text:
oh friends, it has been a long time since i've enjoyed having a body. i'm starting to feel like a fraud because i feel fine so long as i'm laying down so what do i possibly have to complain about? just because sitting upright causes intense pain that can last for hours after but it's not like i'm in constant agony anymore, so obviously i have no right to whine. and i do feel whiny as all hell. even though i've fought against these words my entire adult life, i can't help but get caught in the "but others have it worse" trap. i *know* that that sentiment is bullshit that delegitimizes real experiences and i will tell anyone thinking that that their pain is real and deserves space but fuuuuuuuuuuuck if that isn't the only theme in my brain lately, from "other people's rapes were so violent" to "does it actually count as surviving suicide" to "i wasn't even in the psych ward for a week," i'm just reeling in a pit of "well it wasn't bad *enough*, what happened/is happening to me."
.
people keep telling me i'm brave and that i've made it through so much and i keep feeling like no come on it's nothing lately. what the fuck is that?? that's been more or less the only topic in therapy the last three weeks (was it only three weeks ago that i cried during physical therapy? it feels like a million years or another person entirely). i haven't actually told my therapist that my "it's not bad enough" feelings are extending to every traumatic thing in my life because there hasn't been enough space to fit it in, in between trying to figure out where the hell this garbage came from. (spoiler alert: childhood, because on top of everything else i've hit a therapy cliche moment.)
.
ughhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh i just want to not feel so guilty all the time. like i'm taking away from other people's pain by having my own. even writing this, i'm feeling like come on you whiny asshole, you don't have it that bad.
.
but i can't sit without pain, and i was repeatedly sexually assaulted, and i almost killed myself, and i still have paranoia even on my amazing meds. it is bad enough. whatever happened to you, whatever's wrong, it's bad enough. i can hold that for you until you believe it yourself.

text:
is anyone else currently glued to the live updates on the kavanaugh hearing happening right now in the states? dr. ford’s testimony from yesterday and all that has happened as a response from all sides (kavanaugh, reps, dems, the media, yale university, the american bar association etc...) is shaking me to my core. ⠀
⠀
this might not be our country but it speaks volumes on how we as a north american culture treat power & male privilege & partisan politics & survivors of sexual assault in our society. and what we prioritize as most important. ⠀
⠀
its clear that we are in the midst of a cultural tipping point and i can feel the weight of the heartbreak, the exhaustion and desperation for change. because the status quo is 1 in 5 women in the usa & 1 in 3 women in canada will be sexually assaulted at some point in her lifetime. and 99% of perpetrators are never held accountable for their actions.⠀
⠀
survivors live on with trauma that never leaves and perpetrators have the luxury of forgetting the details of an assault as if it never happened. ⠀
⠀
we must do better for our daughters. ⠀
⠀
how this supreme court nomination is handled matters. ⠀
whether or not kavanaugh is willing to submit himself to a full fbi investigation matters. ⠀
if the republications continue to push forward on a confirmation vote, without the investigation and all the facts confirmed, matters. ⠀
why trump even chose this man to nominate in the first place, matters. ⠀
⠀
because how we treat survivors of sexual assault and what actions we say can be justified matters. ⠀
⠀
and a man of integrity and utmost character *should* know all this and, whether guilty or not, step down, instead of seeking his own advancement at the sake of others. that what it means to honour the country above yourself and to do the right, be it hard, things. ⠀
⠀
#inmyopinion ⠀
⠀
photo by @crystalmariesingphotography

text:
i’m actually really excited. history in america is happening. right. now. this past year women have finally been given the strength to speak out. to stand up. say bullshit! we aren’t taking this any more! 
i’m standing up for a world where my daughter can run down the street without feeling threatened by an endless barrage of unwelcome and threatening catcalls.  a world where she can go to school without being blamed for being a “distraction” when she wears her sports tanks. a world where she can go grocery shopping at night without fearing for her life in a parking lot. a world where she can go explore alone and enjoy solitude without the threat of being assaulted. a world where she can be literally anything she wants because...why the hell wouldn’t she be able to? 
if you are confused by the #metoo or #ibelieveher movements, i’m actually happy for you. that means you’ve never been a victim or forced into silence against your will either from one controlling person or the controlling society you were a part of. but i can almost guarantee you someone you know, someone close to you has. 
i’m so grateful for the women before me who have paved the path for me to be where i am today. we still have so far to go but guess what- i’m not angry. i’m excited. #itshappening. we’re like goonies- this is our time. now is the time we can say no more. i’m excited to witness and be part of history in the making. 
allow women to speak. allow us to be people. as others have brought to our attention- we aren’t just “somebody’s sister.” “somebody’s daughter.” “somebody’s mother.” we are “somebody.” we have the right to speak up. others don’t have the right to tell us when that time is.

.

.

text:
when i'm in a public place and i get in my car, the first thing i do is lock the door. why? out of fear of being assaulted by a man while i turn my back to put my purse on the seat, or while i strap my daughter into her car seat. every single time. i don't listen to music when i run even though music makes me a better runner. this week, while our house is under construction, i rush to leave the house before the workers arrive. they are kind, hard-working men. but i am conditioned to be afraid. in my own house. yesterday, for the first time since construction started, my husband came home from work while the construction guys were still there. my husband began his normal post-work routine - told me about his day, changed out of his work clothes. but yesterday i interrupted him. "go talk to them. i want them to see my husband," i told him. "i want them to know i am 'spoken for'". i actually said "spoken for" out loud. i am a strong, independent, educated woman. yet, i am filled with anxiety. i hate it. but fear is a powerful motivator. i clutch the shoulder straps of my purse while i walk to signal with my body language that i am closed, don't look at me, i'm invisible, a less likely target. i could go on about modified behaviors that have become instinctual. and i know i'm not alone. 
to the men in my network - are any of your every day behaviors motivated by fear? do you feel scared every time you get in your car? do you think society will roll its eyes at you for being paranoid? and if you are attacked, blame you for not being vigilant? asking for a friend...all of my female friends. #metoo

text:
to all my ladies: if you've been ignoring what's been going on, it's time to pay attention. this isn't a democrat vs republican issue. period. this is a human f*cking rights epidemic. i don't care if you don't like politics or confrontation. do some research and at least form an opinion; it's necessary to make positive progress for the future of our country (this irrefutably applies to racial discrepancies in addition). we should love and uplift each other, not tear one another down. to the victims of any level of maltreatment due to factors out of their control: i hear you, i see you, i believe you, and i am with you ✊🏻. ps i respect everyone's opinion. however, delete me or kindly move around if this bothers you. no negative comments here.
.
.
.
#humanrights #justsaying #donthatemen #donthatewhitepeople #notahippy #nopoliticalaffiliation #bekindtooneanother #bekind #accept #openminded #nobullshit #nohate #veteran #femaleveteran #usarmyveteran #lovemycountry #hope #everyoneissomeone #metoo #withher #americadeservesmore

text: moon over eagle harbor.  i pulled over to think and feel about all i’d been reading in the news.  for a moment i took off the covering separating me from full awareness of previous painful experiences.  without detailing the #metoo conveyor belt of experiences which i mostly approach only one at a time and in private—let me just say the moon shining and reflecting on the water soothed and comforted me.  reminded me that we can approach things gently through reflected light.  that there is beauty present regardless of circumstances.  i feel gratitude to be so fortunate to have the ability to share creative work as a joyful experience in its own and also a healing of past memories for myself and others.  wishing healing and gentleness for all who are healing past traumas and a reminder to take time to breathe, pause, see god’s comforting beauty waiting for the moment the tears clear from our eyes.  #healing #moon #bainbridgeisland #ios #eagleharbor #pause #remember #metoo #heal #comfort #god #love #forgiveness #soothe #reflection #light #traveler #spirit

text:
another reason

some survivors (including me) have incomplete memories of the traumatic event(s). incomplete memories make others doubt what happened....but even worse is the self doubt!!! it's so much easier to believe that nothing ever happened. facing the trauma is among the hardest things i've ever done. true warrior healing.

those that have survived assault often experience dissociation: "dissociation is an adaptive response to threat and is a form of “freezing”. it is a strategy that is often used when the option of fighting or running (fleeing) is not an option. we shut down to draw less attention to ourselves, or in extreme cases, play dead by leaving our body and mentally and emotionally shutting down. it is important to know that dissociation is a normal response in the face of trauma." #ibelievesurvivors

text:
our bodies. our lives. our right to decide...wish i was protesting outside of the supreme court with @alexacrisa today. sharing this from our trip to #ireland in 2016 because whether we’re talking about our health, our autonomy or our right to equal standing under the law, it’s all the same fight for women across the world. and we have to fight it together. i believe survivors. i still believe anita hill. i believe #christineblaseyford, and i stand with the one out of three american women who experience sexual violence in their lifetimes. male allies, are you listening? we need you to use your voices. #latergram #throwback #believewomen
.

text:
part1:
i have yet to watch dr. ford’s hearing. yesterday i was lost to the world, swimming in nature with the whales, sea lions, and birds of the water. 
yet, the weight of this extremely public conversation fell hard this morning as i woke. you can never escape the reality of this trauma or abuse. we are all all too familiar with it. it hits home.

i too have an attempted rape story. it happened when i was 12. my step brother at the time came home one day and decided to try and rape me. i felt horribly ashamed and i told no one. i wrote about it my diary years later and my step mom found it. she made copies, sent it out to my family and reported it to the police. maybe her motivation was to hold her son accountable, but it only brought me more shame. 
when i had to recount to the police what had happened 3 years after the fact, i felt like a total fraud. i felt horribly guilty. i felt terribly ashamed. i was so worried about making a mess, about others not believing me, about protecting my ex-step brother… i hated myself through the process wishing i could bury it all again. 
i still feel ashamed. how fucked up is that? how fucked up is it that our culture makes the victim hold the guilt? how fucked up is it that we are so engrained with rape culture that we would rather remain silent for fear of the repercussions of speaking out?

nothing happened after that police report. it felt like trauma piled on top of trauma. and no one really ever spoke of it again. 
but it’s never left me. 
#metoo #ibelieveher #stopkavanaugh #endrapeculture #deathtothepatriarchy #endsexualviolence

text: i gently remind you of the power in your emotional world. emotions rise, feel them, and let them pass. dis-ease comes from stopping our flow of emotion. at this time in our evolution it is essential to feel the depth of our pain, rage, and grief. only in surrendering to these big emotions will we tap into the infinite unstoppable power of the divine goddess on planet earth. if you are triggered by my expression i hope you look deeply into your own wound around expressing “negative” emotion. i love you #rage #revolution #raw #emotion #truth #grief #video #inspire #metoo #1in6 #every98seconds

text: i’ve been harassed more times than i care to admit. i was assaulted numerous times by my boyfriend my freshman year of high school. i never said anything because i thought nobody would believe me since he was my boyfriend. so i’m sharing it now. and i still feel shame. and i still feel like i’m to blame. i’m not putting this out there as a pity party. i’m saying it because everyone knows someone who has been assaulted. #metoo is not a joke.

text:
have you ever said or thought the following:
✔️“i don’t follow politics”
✔️ “i don’t trust any politicians”
✔️ “my vote doesn’t count”
✔️ “i don’t know who to vote for”
✔️ “it doesn’t effect me-so why should i care”

this is judge kavanaugh he is up for the supreme court nomination. unfortunately, it looks like he’s going to get in.
he can and will take away your rights as a woman to decide what you can and more scary what you can’t do with your own body.  it is a life time appointment for him and could mean a lifetime appointment for you to be a mother...are you ready for that?

time is up women!
#vote #metoo  #woman #humanrights

text: moved by this sketch by our own @paulaballah who many of you know from her live drawing at our events. 🙏🏽we sit riveted at this moment in our nation’s history, when, once again, the state of gender politics is front and center. once again #thatladything is happening where powerful men can say they respect dr. ford and believe “something happened to her” but won’t grant even a weeklong investigation to determine the facts surrounding her testimony. is this really the best we can do when appointing someone to a body meant to be the ultimate arbiter of integrity and lawful judgment in the land? we are sick. we are tired. we are sadly unsurprised. make no mistake, this process is about power, not justice. we believe you dr. ford. we (still) believe you anita hill. women across the land have had enough. we will no longer stay quiet to protect the privilege of the powerful. #speakout #metoo #womenempowerment #believewomen. ***** and lookie there: just now, jeff flake says he’s a no if there’s no investigation. developing.....

text: i couldn’t decide which purple yarn to use. so i’m using all three. switching them out when it feels right. no pattern. no rules. just creating my own flow and changing it up when the mood hits me. sometimes i forget to be creative. sometimes i forget that the capacity to change and grow are within my own hands. i get to be flexible. i’m allowed to change my mind. i can even make mistakes. that’s part of life’s process. if i don’t catch my knitting mistakes early on, i usually leave them. it’s a nice reminder of our shared humanity. it’s part of being real. of being human. i think that’s where the growth begins, with our willingness to see ourselves fully. to meet ourselves where we are. to start right there. one stitch at a time. #thecounterstoolwherereallifehappens #onestitchatatime #mindfulness #knitting #beyou #behuman #bereal #sharedhumanity #showup #honestliving #knitting #allthepurple #create #kindness #metoo

text:
you deserve to be listened to and believed. we all deserve to have our opinions listened to, considered, and respected. .
.
if a well educated white woman can’t speak openly about her experiences and be respected and believed, how many voices are never even invited to the platform? how many are too scared or too at risk to even feel capable of speaking their truths?
.
.
it is absolutely terrifying to consider trying to live a normal life in a country where the most entitled and ignorant white men get to control who’s opinions matter. .
.
lean into your support systems where you can. there is respect and understanding out there, and we are here for you.

text:
my disgust and outrage have overtaken eloquence, but i will try: i honestly believed @jeffflake would act with the decency i have respected in him in the past, and do the right thing. instead, he and the rest of the yes voters are sending a strong reminder to women and survivors (who, combined, constitute over 50% of this country) that we are less than, unimportant, disrespected, tossed out, and unrepresented. i am ashamed that these men represent me as an american. even if you choose to ignore the blatant and obvious differences in the two testimonies yesterday, this man is unfit to be an impartial and non-partisan judge. he showed us _that_ with 100% certainty. despicable. 
thank you, #drford, for your vulnerability and for speaking up. i hear you, and i am with you. 
#stopkavanaugh #noonkavanaugh #believewomen #ibelieveher #ibelievechristineblaseyford #thankyoudrford #scotus @kamalaharris @sensusancollins @senlisamurkowski @corybooker @senatorchuckgrassley @senatororrinhatch @lindseygrahamsc @johncornyn @sentedcruz @mikecrapo @senjohnkennedy @maziehirono @senblumenthal @amyklobuchar @senwhitehouse @durbincampaign @senatorleahy #metoo #impeach #kavanope

text: firestarter🔥 i think my entire life i have tried to create opportunities for me to share my point of view. not because i felt i was better than anyone else but because i felt i did not fit into the present opportunities & bc i can see potential better than many of my peers. i value people’s energy. while it has always been easy for me to transmit what i may be thinking about, it has been hard as hell for me to get out what i was feeling. writing was difficult for me. speaking was worse. my passion and strong presence came out as adversarial in the patriarchy world. i had a bs story about it. the result was a life long episode of the wrong tone, too much information, complete silence after repeated misunderstandings, ineffective asks, unnoticed writing and unappreciated speech or down played perspective.  it took me so long to do this soul healing work i am really good at and love to offer because i could not communicate the similarity between spirituality and modern science. there really are few modern teachers and books on these things😂. thank goddess for quantum physics and the discovery of epigenetic influencers &the profound fungi, bacterial microbiome making things. it made the powers of consciousness and mindfulness and community &personal beliefs matter. so when i inspire a budding #medicinewomanrising or #medicineman to start to share their work and communicate back to them their own unique point of view , i kind of tear up with joy. 🤩this has really been a lot of patience in my personal evolution mixed w/patience for societal revolutions like #metoo . waiting for the brave ones to emerge & hear my calling #medicinewomanrising has been an exciting +exhausting 2 years but we are here! so in the words of one of the worst patriarchal driven , but effectively marketed corporate greed insults to women’s health , you’ve come a long way baby” 💕 i celebrate our choice to put down the cancer sticks and pick up the wizards wand. i applaud the courage of all conscious beings who no longer will allow mediocre communities to grow or remain in power. #powerofnow #womenscircles #divinemasculine #divinefeminine #sacredunion #healthcaregoals #healthehealers
name: Goddess Maker & Life Changer

text:
i don’t know if men or the men on the judiciary committee can truly understand the difficulty of coming forward to place such accusations. i can tell you from personal experience they would have been no evidence other than me saying i was molested, raped and attempted rape. why would she want to relieve these events? she did this as her civic duty. brave not only is this woman is a but a hero to me and many survivors alike. why would she put her family in danger, her life will never be the same. as a lie and how would she benefit from this? these last few days i can’t even imagine how difficult and the pain she must be experiencing. for any sexual assault survivors as well. this is the time for family and friends to step up and help their family members. check in make sure they are doing ok. for survivors spouses, family and friends we are not asking for anyone to fix things or for resolutions. we just want an ear to listen, comfort, a shoulder to cry on. this country is becoming more divided everyday. we cannot let that happen to our families as well. family first. always!!! sending much love to #christineblaseyford and all #sexualabuse survivors 💖💖💖 #ibelieveyou #youarenotalone #survivorsunite #actwithrainn
#girlsruletheworld #onceawarrior #beautifulandbroken

text:
slide ——>
#enoughisenough 
3 women have come forward about kavanaugh assaults. just a reminder that a supreme court nomination is for life - there is too much at stake! 
when can we be done with this narrative in our country where survivors are threatened more than assaulters and rapists? when will we stop appointing & electing people like kavanaugh to office? today may be that day. do not let history repeat itself. you have a chance now to make your voice heard: call (202) 224-3121 and tell them to vote no on kavanaugh. the senate is making their decision today. 
also, many survivors are male, and it’s important to recognize this - two of my previous male partners had been sexually assaulted or raped. love and healing for all, which can only come when we recognize our oppression, identify we have an issue and make a conscious decision in a different direction. 
#stopkavanaugh #kavanaugh #supremecourt #whatsatstake #ibelieveher #believesurvivors #useyourvoice #resist #anitahill #stopvictimblaming #endrapeculture #smashthepatriarchy #metoo

text_retweet:
#repost @bobby_cannavale
・・・
i still believe her. look, lots of emotional responses to my post yesterday. lots of vitriol. it’s ok, free country and all that. speaking for myself and only myself? i believe in trying to change our culture of treating women like they’re second class humans, like their testimonies are unimportant and a distraction. equality for women, for people of color, for our lgbtq brothers and sisters is something we need to, collectively, continue to strive for. otherwise, who are we? i know it’s popular to say hateful shit to each other right now, especially while hiding behind private accounts, again all good, free country. i’m gonna keep trying to listen and to understand what these incredibly brave women have to say.i believe dr. ford. i will continue to listen and to believe these women in my gut. and if you don’t like what i have to say, again, all good. just unfollow. #metoo

text: #believewomen 🙏🏽 thank you #drchristineblaseyford for your courage to stand up and tell your story. so many of us women have similar stories - where privileged, entitled, scumbags think they can do whatever they want. and think it’s funny. nothing can erase the memory of such disgusting events. going back 20, 30, 40 years.... you may not remember the details of who drove you home, or how you got there, but you’ll never forget this type of “boy” or their acts of abuse. many of us grew up with these guys in high school or college. and we’ve said nothing as we’ve sat back and watched them start families and “grow up” to be many different  things. one thing they shouldn’t be is in charge of making our decisions. thank you dr. christine blasey ford for standing up and speaking your truth. you are an inspiration. and i hope every young women watching all of this will be moved to say something the minute one of these #evil (yes, #kavanaugh evil) idiots steps out of line. #speakyourtruth #stopkavanaugh #lovetrumpshate #metoomovement #metoo

text:
as you weigh emotions & opinions today regarding dr. ford & judge kavanaugh, please try & understand that there are deep wounds being ripped open for many assault survivors across the nation. our nations treatment of sexual assault, or non-treatment, has aided in the continuous atrocities seen across our nation regarding, primarily, women. 
be gentle to us! 
be patient! 
don’t attack. 
don’t judge. 
#mentalhealth #graceupongrace #endabuse #endthetrend #endthestigma #mentalillness #mentalhealthawareness #metoo

text:
i haven't been able to use my brace since june. it needed to be serviced and then recalibrated. i couldn't get an appointment until after i moved. and then it took waiting for new insurance, two appointments, and a referral. so i was pretty excited when i was finally in an orthotist office again. 
except even after calibration the brace wasn't working as i remembered. i'd have twenty good steps and then it felt broken for twenty steps and then it would feel right again. i tried to convey this to my doctor. she called the ottobock rep, who told her it was user error and i just needed to get used to it again. 
i was sent home. it's been a week and the same brace weirdness continues. i've seen this a lot: doctors and others in a position of authority not believing me. not trusting all my "i feel" statements and not listening. my experience and the #metoomovement have made me realize how little weight our society gives to the personal narrative. to the story of a single individual without credentials or the obvious trappings of power. this costs all the marginalized voices. the women's voices, the disabled vices, the young voices. personal experience is a powerful thing. there may not be a formal mechanism for proof, but we still have to listen and believe.

text: don't suffer in silence. you are not #alone. definitely used their services since i was a teen they really helped. sometimes you may not even know how to put your #feelings into words, reach out! your information is #confidential and for some of us with little to no #trust thats a big thing. they will not #pressure you, they will not #shame you they will not #blame you. they will offer to link you to local services and you can decline or accept with no #judgement. and most importantly they will #listen. simply take 1 of the many steps on your #healing #journey talk about it. set yourself #free, take back your #power. give yourself the love you deserve. and if you choose to not reach out thats ok #love just know that you are not alone and you are #stronger than you give yourself credit for. look how far you've made it already! take it one day at a time sometimes even a  minute at a time. be #gentle to yourself. #rainn @rainn ps, none of us will know if you click the links or not or call them this is your journey march at your own pace. #bestrong #beloved #notalone this goes for #men #women #children #teens #elderly #lgbtq https://www.rainn.org/about-national-sexual-assault-telephone-hotline i bid you #strength and #courage on your journey. #survivor #metoo

text: anita hill. christine blasey ford. me. you. victims of sexual assault, who are silenced, shamed, and/or blamed for the actions of another by a society that makes a mockery of our voices and pain. this photo set was inspired by a pulp fiction piece i wrote on a survivor turned vigilante. if you've ever been sexually assaulted the sadness, confusion, and rage may ring true. if you're not, i invite you to read it and ponder what it must feel like to say "no" with your voice and your actions and be ignored, and how an encounter like this changes you forever. read "the vortex" via the #linkinbio

text_retweet:
this striking image was taken at pitch her’s february riveter series. the theme of that screening was #metoo. somehow today, specifically today, —many, many months, accusations, doubts, and (some) convictions later — that theme is still painfully relevant.
. . . 
on this night in february we saw films by women exploring the realities of sexual violence and rape culture. on this night, we absorbed, we considered, we discussed, we maybe even healed (slightly), in our own ways. we did something our leaders seem incapable of: we believed survivors. yet now here we are, listening to a testimony from a woman describing the horrors that have been unleashed on the lives of her and her family because she spoke up. (anyone still wondering #whyididntreport may want to give those remarks a read.)
. . .
tomorrow night we convene again for our #riveter : яefuge. this time we examine the immigrant experience, the bravery and desperation that causes people to uproot themselves from the lives they know and cross into unknown territories. we can only hope that 7 months from tomorrow, this theme won’t feel so painfully relevant. . . . 
#believesurvivors #christineblaseyford #kavanaughhearings #refuge #immigrantstories #timesup #dreamers #nobannowall #givemeyourtired #resist #riveter #womenpower #riveterseries #pitchher #pitchherproductions #womensupportingwomen 📸 by @charlotteinc #repost @sirromcc

on this night in february we saw films by women exploring the realities of sexual violence and rape culture. on this night, we absorbed, we considered, we discussed, we maybe even healed (slightly), in our own ways. we did something our leaders seem incapable of: we believed survivors. yet now here we are, listening to a testimony from a woman describing the horrors that have been unleashed on the lives of her and her family because she spoke up. (anyone still wondering  may want to give those remarks a read.)
. . .
tomorrow night we convene again for our  : яefuge. this time we examine the immigrant experience, the bravery and desperation that causes people to uproot themselves from the lives they know and cross into unknown territories. we can only hope that 7 months from tomorrow, this theme won’t feel so painfully relevant. . . . 
                📸 by

text:
📷
#درباره_دونالد_جان_ترامپ (۵۴)
کاریکاتوری درباره دکتر فورد، روانشناس و استاد دانشگاه، که ادعاهایی را مبنی بر آزار جنسی بر علیه #قاضی_کاوانا، نامزد معرفی شده از طرف دونالد ترامپ برای تصدی پست #دیوان_عالی، مطرح کرده است.
این پرونده در واقع محل تلاقی چند روند سیاسی و اجتماعی در آمریکای امروز است. یکی رویارویی و وزن کشی دوجناح سیاسی #دموکرات و #جمهوری_خواه. جمهوری خواهان در هفته های پایانی دولت #اوباما در روند معرفی و انتخاب یک قاضی نزدیک به جناح دموکرات اخلال ایجاد کردند و حالا نوبت دموکرات هاست که تلافی کنند. دو اینکه این رویارویی به شکل غیر مستقیم بر وجهه هر کدام از جناح ها اثر گذاشته و احتمالا شکست در این پرونده باعث می شود در انتخابات نوامبر هم بخشی از آرای خاکستری خود را از دست بدهند. سوم، این پرونده (در صورت اثبات ادعاها) مهمترین جنجال #رسوایی_جنسی از زمان به راه افتادن جنبش (#mee_ too) در آمریکا به شمار میرود. جنبشی که از زنان قربانی #آزار_جنسی، به ویژه آنها که قربانی سواستفاده شخصیت های سرشناس و پرنفوذ بوده اند،  دعوت می کند تا تجربیات ناخوشایند خود را بازگو و #متجاوزین را رسوا کنند.
پ.ن: حمایت نمادین مجسمه های آزادی و عدالت از خانم دکتر فورد.
👉@slyngstad_cartoons -  as dr. christine blasey ford testifies to the senate judiciary committee, she will not be alone.
•
#christineblaseyford #drford #ibelievesurvivors #ibelievechristineblaseyford #metoo #stopkavanaugh #brettkavanaugh #nomeansno #statueofliberty #ladyjustice - #regrann

text:
this is not a political post. this is not a post about the kavanaugh hearing. this is a post about women. women finding their voice. for years our stories have been hidden away filled with shame, anger, sadness and humiliation. we’ve listened as society told us that our trauma was somehow our fault or just the way the world works.  we were dominated and silenced, forced to deal with our pain privately or with our small group of confidants. what i’m seeing now, we are getting stronger. we are healing.  one by one women are standing strong to tell their story no matter the consequences.  each story picks at the scabs of our collective trauma. it’s opens us up and makes us raw with emotion. but the surprise to me is each time this happens we are collectively healing. we are learning we are not alone. our stories are different but the themes are the same.  we are learning how to support each other and come together to create collective strength. we are a long way from ending rape culture but we are on the path. for the first time in my life i see our path. we will win. maybe not today but we will create a world that will protect future generations of women from assault.

this is what i’m choosing to focus on this week. 
and to all those friends (both women & men) that supported me and the women i love this week, thank you for joining us on this journey. ❤️. #metoo #metoomovement #wearultraviolet #endrapeculture #riseupwomen #mudgelove
name: Pam Mudge

text:
my heart still feels heavy…heavy with anger, heavy with sadness, heavy with fear. when will this stop? the attacks on women, the harassment, the witch hunt. 💔💔💔
last night i had a breathwork class and the energy of the class was unlike any i have felt. it carried the heaviness of the what’s happening in our country. so i asked my students to open up their heart. to imagine giving love to themselves as a child. and then imagine sending love to every single person on our planet. imagine sending out your love like dandelions. having them fall on anyone who feels alone. who is scared. who is speaking up. who is exhausted of fighting. who is hurting. who feels lost. 💔💔💔
our world would look very different if we knew how to love ourselves. if we knew how to love each other. if we knew the importance of healing ourselves. this weekend i have two classes that will help you start on that journey. tomorrow saturday at 10am i will be hosting an intimate class in my home. and saturday at 5:30pm i will be teaching at unplug meditation in santa monica. dm for more details.  sending you lots of love and light!
💔💔💔
“each time a woman stands up for herself, she stands up for all women.” - maya angelou
📸 @carolina_adame
